Overall%20Experience.Review: There is something for everyone here! the academics are difficult, but the community you can build outside of school is worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley offers a challenging yet rewarding experience. Academically, it’s rigorous, with little hand-holding, but there are plenty of resources like office hours and tutoring if you seek them out. The campus is always buzzing with events, activism, and diverse perspectives, making it an exciting but sometimes overwhelming place. Socially, finding a community takes effort, especially in large lectures, but joining clubs, organizations, or Greek life helps. Housing and food are a mixed bag—dorms vary in quality, and off-campus rent is high. Overall, Berkeley is a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating environment that pushes you to grow, making it ideal for those who thrive under challenge and independence.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at the University of California Berkeley has been one of enjoyment but also one stress and workload. It is no secret that UC Berkeley is a rigorous academic institution but the course load can be daunting to many individuals that are used to the high school curriculum that they had to go through for 4 years. However the student life at Berkeley is very supportive and enjoyable which makes it bearable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a very challenging but good place to go to school. There are many groups and activities that can enhance your experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience at UC Berkeley has been incredibly rewarding, both academically and socially. As a cognitive science major on the Pre-PA track, I love how my classes push me to think critically. The academic rigor challenges me, but the collaborative environment helps me grow.  

Beyond academics, I love how social and dynamic Berkeley is, with study groups, campus events, and a strong sense of community. I thrive in this balance of intellectual stimulation and personal connections.  

Being on the Cal Cheer Team has defined my experience. We dedicate countless hours to training and bringing school spirit to games, yet we are often overlooked as athletes. Despite this, I love the friendships, teamwork, and confidence cheer has given me. Berkeley has made me more driven and resilient, and I’m proud to be part of this university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Berkeley is a great place to be at. The academics here are great, and I have met a lot of great people here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: While UC Berkeley is a school with a sizeable reputation and great influence across research fields and tech industries, the school still has a lot to improve on. This public university has severe issues regarding funding and overcrowding, and many academic resources are stretched thin. Dorms and student housing are only guaranteed for one year and the size of lecture halls and discussions have considerably spiked in numbers. The teacher-to-student ratio is so high that interpersonal learning or connection is simply not an option. Likewise, the school has structural problems regarding school safety and security. Many crimes have occurred on campus grounds and the surrounding area of the City of Berkeley is not the greatest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the Greek life and the academics but I would like to see more clubs that can be open to students from all backgrounds cause why me as a freshman competing with a senior who has golden man sacs offer
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am very happy that I am going to Berkeley. The university provides many great resources to students. It's a great place to learn and grow. Great experience so far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Unwelcoming and hyper-competitive student body, grade deflation, useless administration, and zero safety net. You pay for the name and education, but the education is what you make of it. It's very possible to take the easiest classes and graduate without having learned anything. A toxic culture of competition/exclusivity/condescension where students value getting the grade above all else. I've seen students go days without sleeping, end up homeless, and forgo their health to outcompete peers. A subset of students are alarmingly apathetic to ethics. You're just a money-generating number. It's truly a survival of the fittest institution where you're on your own from the very beginning: academically, socially, getting a job. The social scene is driven by hyper-competitive preprofessional clubs with sub 5% acceptance rates and multiple round interviews and greek life. Pervasive loneliness. I've seen many struggle to find employment after graduation. Professors are the silver lining.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love being at UC Berkeley and am very thankful to be here. Each day no matter how hard it is to get work done or get up in the morning I can never complain because of how happy I am to simply be here and make my family and friends proud.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lovely campus with many brilliant people. One of the best universities in the entire world. Many opportunities for everything.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley has amazing academics, and I hold all my current and previous professors to such high regards. I would not change anything about my academic experience here. The surrounding areas outside of the campus can be a little scary in terms of safety. As a woman, I always feel I have to be extremely cautious every time I step off of campus on my walk home due to the high crime rates. I feel like there is more than can be done to ensure the safety of students in the surrounding areas.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a first-year attending UC Berkeley, I've had an amazing experience so far here. I was fortunate enough to have an amazing orientation group that welcomed me. I got lucky with amazing roomates and an amazing floor who are like family to me. I live near telegraph where I enjoy it because it's very lively and constantly gives me city/college vibes. UC Berkeley has a lot of resources for its students and with easy access. Although sometimes I get imposter syndrome due to the high compeition in the air, I truly enjoy being a part of the undergraduate student body at UC Berkeley.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are a few things I believe UC Berkeley can improve on. The administration takes little to no attention to the students and also lacks the advertisement of all the resources they have. This makes for students, especially if you're new, to deal with things like financial aid, enrollment, tuition, and etc. However, they do have very good resources that are rarely or never seen by most of the students in the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience gets better each semester. The main thing I would like to see change is easier access to advisors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and it has many useful resources.  However, in my experience of the College of Environmental Design, many classes didn't teach much of anything and/or wanted you to learn on your own.  I think that the learning on your own part was fine in High School but in college it was upsetting to be paying professors that would not teach you.  I wanted to go into work knowing how to do my job but instead it was enphasized that they teach how to think and not how to do the work. When I applied to study abroad they even warned us that the colleges abroad had more advanced classes then us.  So it confuses me why UC Berkeley was considered the best public university in the world.  The beauty of the campus, good quality of food, and fun clubs does not compare to the importance of teaching us how to do our job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I naively bought into the "liberal" and "diverse" depictions of UC Berkeley. I very quickly (within one week of stepping foot on campus) realized that this was not the case. 
I was born in the US, but grew up in Mexico due to family circumstances. My identity and racial background has thus shaped many of my experiences. I believed Berkeley would be an inclusive space, where students and faculty alike respected these identities and aimed to provide everyone with just, equitable educational experiences. However, that has not always been the case. 
My experiences have not been uniquely jarring, every single Black of Latine student that I know shares these stories -from being overlooked or even ignored by professors on campus when asking questions, at times, being the only one of our racial/ethnic group within classroom sizes of 100+, applying for hyper-competitive clubs on campus and realizing that again, you are the only one of your racial/ethnic group within the club. We're changing it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Berkeley! The classes here are definitely challenging, but I've learned so much. Berkeley professors are top of the field for so many different departments. I love how there's so much to do nearby, too; it's not an isolated college. Berkeley itself is a city, and you can go to Oakland and SF if you're looking for some extra fun. People here are ambitious, but cooperative. There are a ton of opportunities, too, you just have to look for them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley prepares you for very rigorous experiences. It is a very difficult university but I find it to be worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience has been okay overall. It's common to see homeless people on campus, which makes me feel uneasy because of the unpredictable nature of what they might do. I usually try to maintain a safe distance, but there are times when I have to pass by them since it's the only route to my classes. Another area for improvement is the dining hall food because sometimes it upsets my stomach.

On a positive note, Berkeley has some of the top professors in the world who do an excellent job teaching. Additionally, there are many student organizations to join, providing opportunities to get involved on campus. However, some of the more popular and academically oriented organizations are competitive to get into.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would say that Berkeley has done for me more than I can say, in terms of the quality of the academics and research opportunities that make Berkeley what it is, but it’s reputation is definitely not wholly accurate to the realities of attending the school. For starters, the campus life and amount of clubs, societies, and programs surprised me, as all that I had known about Berkeley was its academic prowess. The social programs of Berkeley are just as prevalent and significant to its characterization as anything else. Furthermore, its positioning beside both Oakland and San Francisco make it incredibly lively and accessible due to the great amount of public transit and diverse array of activities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: In my experience in Berkeley, I really like how there’s always a community for support and you aren’t held back from saying what you think is right. I really enjoy my friends and professors as they really make my learning experience fun and enjoyable. Some things I might want to see change is how scary it might be at night when you’re walking in a dark street. Maybe more lights somewhere, but other than that I really do enjoy Berkeley. The environment is also a big factor, you can walk somewhere and sit there, and you’ll feel at peace. All the trees and small waterfalls, as well as the hiking trails make little parts of the school like small getaways.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was great for a first time independent student. Everything is near by and local. I really enjoyed how lively campus was also.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great undergraduate experience and would recommend this school to anyone interested! The Berkeley environment is so unique and the people you meet are wonderful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My almost two years at the University of California, Berkeley, have been a life-changing experience that blends tough academics with an exciting campus life. The university is dedicated to research and creativity, offering a wide variety of programs that encouraged me to explore different subjects and develop a well-rounded view. The professors are not only experts in their fields but also genuinely care about helping students succeed, often providing extra guidance and support. 
Events like Cal Day and various cultural festivals brought students together, celebrating our differences and fostering a sense of community. One major concern is how easy it is for students, especially those with financial struggles, to access resources. Making more affordable housing available and offering additional financial help for living costs would really reduce this stress, allowing students to concentrate more on their studies instead of worrying about money.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I personally really liked how Berkeley makes a point to pair you with students in your specific major, making it much easier to meet new people, make connections, and improve my networking skills.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are very accessible outside classroom and classes are rigorous. But the campus area usually gets slightly unsafe after dark.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely LOVE UC Berkeley. Its really whatever you make of it.The academic experience here is definitely challenging, but I think some students tend to overdo how hard it is. The key is really about being proactive—if you go to class, study hard, make connections with your professors and TAs, and make the most of resources like office hours or tutoring, you will do well. Berkeley provides so many tools to help you succeed, and as long as you actively seek them out, the workload is manageable. Berkeley’s prestige and incredible professors are undeniable. They are so knowledgeable and passionate, and the education you receive here is absolutely worth it. However, one thing I’ve noticed is that the amenities don’t really match the reputation. Compared to other UCs, our facilities could definitely use some upgrades. It’s a little surprising, especially given the stature of the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors at Berkeley are typically world class researchers who have incredible expertise in their fields. The graduate students who help teach classes are also very knowledgeable and capable. As a student who transferred to Berkeley during the pandemic, I would have liked to have had more targeted post graduate employment support from Berkeley.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: At the University of California at Berkeley I really enjoyed that downtown was walkable and I was able to enjoy the city and all it has to offer in terms of food and entertainment without needing a vehicle. What I would like to see changed would be the safety on campus. The campus is not safe at night due to the large homeless population and the amount of crimes committed on campus. An increase in security would make it a much safer place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a spring junior transfer student; I've enrolled in my first semester, and I'm excited but also really nervous. Judging from what I've been exposed to so far, Cal is really diverse, huge, and full of opportunities, but it really asks you to give your all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love my experience at UC Berkeley! As a freshman, I haven’t been able to explore much, but I do love the competitive academic culture that helps me stay focused on my studies. I also get to explore the beautiful downtown on the weekends, filled with fun cafes and activities for my roommates and I!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley was pretty great my first semester. Housing, food, and extracurriculars were just about average, classes were slightly above average. My second semester, I struggled with my mental health, and every single system that was supposed to provide assistance, prevent discrimination, stop harassment from occurring that was being committed by a university club completely failed. It got to be so bad I had to withdraw, and the club is still harassing me. Berkeley is sort of just a big bureaucratic nightmare.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a wonderful experience at Berkeley! The campus is beautiful and there are plenty of things going on. It’s definitely a rigorous course load but my professors have been very understanding and supportive. The libraries are lovely and there are a bunch of study rooms open all over campus. The food on campus is okay but there are restaurants right next to some lecture halls that are delicious.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a very, very nice college with extremely up to date programs and professors, an easy choice for anyone looking for a stem college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Not enough protests, just a lot of business majors that join consulting clubs that do nothing other than the grunt work consulting firms don't want to pay for. Name of school is good for me, dorms aren't updated/renovated, dining halls are fine, but I get the same thing every day. Overall good school based on name alone, but the people can be A-holes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: very different and appealing for a college student looking for a different or alternative environment and student life
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school has a good reputation. The funding is noticably too low. Classrooms are cramped and dilapidated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at UC Berkeley was pretty good overall, although the commute to school and back was quite tiring. The food at the dining hall and cafe was great and there are many places to eat around the school which is good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley has been an intense, eye-opening experience. The academics are rigorous and demand resilience. However being honest the professors here are incredibly knowledgeable but don’t always provide the support you might expect, pushing you to become self-reliant and resourceful. The surrounding area has its challenges, and safety can be a concern; adapting to this environment has been essential. Yet, despite these obstacles, the level of collaboration and intellect Berkeley offers is unmatched. It’s a community of ambitious individuals constantly pushing boundaries, and the challenges have ultimately been worth it, pushing me to grow academically and personally in ways I never imagined.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s easy to feel lost here as a student — classes are huge for the most part. Office hours are abundant and essential to success, to get extra help from professors or TAs. The campus life is great—there are so many student groups to explore your hobbies.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I feel that Berkeley was a great school overall. People who would apply to this school would really enjoy it here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a thriving community. The student body lives up to the expectations of outspoken politics and diversity, although the staff and admin don't always reflect this which can feel demoralizing. I love my specific program but it fits my personal interests quite well. Others might have trouble connecting with required classes and elective options, which can be limited because enrollment is very competitive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a UC Berkeley student, I feel incredibly fortunate to be part of such a dynamic and intellectually stimulating environment. The campus buzzes with energy, from late-night study sessions at the library to lively discussions in the quad. The diversity of perspectives here is inspiring; I’ve made friends from all over the world who challenge my views and broaden my horizons. The professors are passionate and accessible, often encouraging us to engage in research that addresses real-world problems. The wealth of resources available, from cutting-edge labs to vibrant student organizations, fuels my curiosity and creativity. Plus, being in the Bay Area means I have endless opportunities for internships and networking in tech and social justice, allowing me to apply what I learn in the classroom to the outside world. I’m constantly discovering new passions, whether through classes, workshops, or events hosted by student groups. It's an exhilarating experience with fun and entretaiments.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a great city with plenty of food and things to do nearby! Social scene is also pretty good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, UC Berkeley is a truly hit or miss experience. The type of housing, professors, and classes you get really make or break the college experience. A lot of things are lottery based such as housing offers, class registration times, etc so if you are not a lucky person it is not as fun of an experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like it here. There was a lot of clubs for me to apply to, and I got into most of them and made some friends there. The people I've met so far are not as mean as I was told they'd be. It's honestly really exciting here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are a lot of people here to make friends with. The city is also pretty expansive with a lot of places to go and a lot of places to eat. The downside is that it’s pretty expensive and trying to live off of just local food places is tough.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: In many ways, I regret choosing to attend this school. Despite the academic opportunities and education offered here, students have effectively zero institutional support once they step foot inside. Every single opportunity is extremely competitive—think thousands applying for a single-digit number of spots for every single interesting thing, the intense grade deflation, ineffective counselors who couldn't care less about your future and view you merely as another data point, navigating resources gatekept by a bureaucratic nightmare, and no career support. You're truly left to fend for yourself in everything you do. Cal is a university where the top 5% have all the opportunities in the world opened to them while the remaining 95% are forced out into the world with no safety net and shaky prospects. A large number of students here in supposedly highly sought-after programs have struggled to find a job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of California at Berkeley is a large, diverse school with excellent academics. There are many resources, clubs, and opportunities for all students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed Berkeley, especially the athletics like water polo, since I played in high school and I'm a big fan.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall a great school academically, but many aspects could be improved on, such as housing, crime, and general life balance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, UC Berkeley is an incredible school for academics. The level of intelligence of fellow classmates and professors is outstanding. However, the other qualities of the school are where it is lacking. Safety is horrible, homeless people everywhere. Housing is inhumane. Berkeley promotes itself as a diverse school when in reality, over 50% of the population is Asian.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the energy and culture of Berkeley. I love the location, the proximity to SF and East Bay nature preserves but still embodying the college town vibe. Many of the students are inspiring, and professors really want you to get the most out of your education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes can be hit or miss - if possible, always choose profs with good ratings on Rate My Professor. Took some of my favorite classes that way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a minority student at UC Berkeley, my experience has been both challenging and rewarding. Initially, I found aspects of campus life exclusive, making it hard to find my place. However, I've grown to love this school deeply. The academic rigor and world-class faculty have been the highlights, making every challenge worthwhile. While large classes and a competitive atmosphere can be daunting, the research opportunities and diverse student body have enriched my experience. Through student organizations, study groups, and engaging with professors, I've found my community and thrived. Despite the high living costs and initial feelings of exclusion, the skills and connections I've gained have set a strong foundation for my future. The academic excellence and personal growth I've experienced have transformed my life, making Berkeley an unforgettable part of my journey. The professors and curriculum are exceptional, ultimately making everything worth it tenfold.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley allowed me to set up a professional and educational life. Already only in the first year, my perspective about engineering was widened. They do a good job caring for their students when it comes to public things like health and materials, but it is hard to put yourself out there. I would like to see the housing department improve by cross-checking the housing availability and emails. Double-checking will permit less miscommunication.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My time at UC Berkeley has been exceptional. The campus environment is vibrant and filled with a strong sense of community, driven mainly by the students and faculty's hard work and dedication. The energy on campus is truly inspiring, with countless opportunities for intellectual growth and personal development.
However, the Berkeley/Oakland area does present some challenges. Issues like unpredictability, occasional robberies, homelessness, and violence can sometimes affect the overall experience. While these concerns are real, they are mitigated by the dynamic and resilient spirit of the campus community.
Given these factors, it would be beneficial to see continued efforts to address and improve the surrounding area's safety and well-being. With the right strategies and collective efforts, I believe in enhancing the safety and well-being of our community while maintaining the remarkable vitality and academic merit that UC Berkeley bears.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Being an undergrad at UC Berkeley was an incredible ride. The campus buzzed with energy and ideas, and it felt like there was always something exciting happening. Whether it was sitting in on a lecture by a top-notch professor or diving into a heated discussion with classmates, the intellectual atmosphere was electric. I loved how the university pushed us to think critically and explore new concepts, making every class and project feel both challenging and rewarding.

Outside of academics, Berkeley was just as amazing. There was so much to get involved in, from joining quirky clubs to attending cool events. The campus itself was beautiful and had a way of making you feel right at home. The friendships I made and the experiences I had there were unforgettable, and they really shaped who I am today. Overall, my time at UC Berkeley was a perfect mix of learning, growth, and fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Helloo, my experience at Berkeley has been eventful. There is always some event going on and the campus life is active. There is diversity although lacking in the hispanic community. Overall, there is going to be a place where you can apart of. You will be able to explore many great clubs and meet many people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I greatly appreciate UC Berkeley's strong academic reputation. UC Berkeley is known for its reputable programs and faculty. I was able to secure an internship at a law firm that handles cases with high-profile clientele, and being a UCB student was a main contributing factor. UC Berkeley's students are known for their academics, therefore we have greater chances of being involved in internships, research, and projects. I also like how there is many Nobel laureate faculty members. If a research opportunity presents itself you have a chance to work with them or even attend their courses and seminars. I love the campus, which consists of historic buildings such as the Sather tower. However,  I would like to see the cost of living change at UC Berkeley. Majority of Juniors and Seniors, such as myself, choose to live off campus, and the cost of living is challenging. Unfortunately, the closer you are to campus, the worse conditions the apartments are and more expensive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Berkeley has not only been extremely academically intensive but eye-opening. The community, culture, and opportunities have been unmatched and my main reason for attending. Throughout my tenure at Berkeley so far, I have been able to mold who I am as a person through rigorous courseload and friends made along the way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed UC Berkeley and all that it had to offer. I found the classes challenging but interesting. There was so much to do on and off campus. The Bay Area is so beautiful and provided a stunning backdrop to my undergraduate years. The nature can be competitive but there are many opportunities to find support systems.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience in UC Berkeley was mainly focused on academics and working part time. While I believed the professors were great at times it did feel like much when I also had to worry about paying rent. There were hardly any options for affordable housing which would often lead to stress. Thankfully the campus life and the rec center helped me a lot to relieve stress with friends and simply working out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of California Berkeley is a top notch institution, especially for stem students. At this school, you will be open to many opportunities not present in ordinary schools. In addition to work opportunities graduate opportunities also arise from attending Berkeley
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley offers an enriching and dynamic experience with top-notch faculty, diverse student body, and ample research opportunities. The campus life is vibrant with numerous clubs and events. Balancing rigorous academics in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, and Business enhances critical skills.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great. Love the school. Campus is easy to get around. Good parties if you're looking. Dorms not great, especially foothill. Food terrible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall I had a good time so far. Good academics with a lot of opportunities. Can get competitive and not super safe area.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the school. It is ranked high, it is fun, it is in a great location, and the professors are great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really appreciate UC Berkeley as a school with great academic opportunities and academic rigor. At the same time, UC Berkeley students tend to, in aggregate, understand their connection to the world around them and are very engaged in social justice movements and protests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The classes are challenging but despite its reputation of being cutthroat and full of students who will backstab you I have never had that issue and have made excellent friends within my major because we are all struggling through the same classes together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall I’m grateful for the opportunities Berkeley presents me. The professors and GSi do try their best to help students under the material as best as possible. I would like to see netter safety measures as I myself had a crime encounter and so has my friends. It would he wise for the university to invest and help the schools safety and not only care about academics. Also the food should be better quality as we are paying a lot for tuition and all we get is the same routined food all the time, not even the cereal machines works at times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've only been at Cal for a year so I don't have too much to say. However, I have really enjoyed my time there. At Cal, I can challenge myself academically and then go off somewhere to just be a young adult. I'm thankful for the opportunities I get to grow as a student and as an individual. The school spirit and campus life is really fun to be a part of and all school events are entertaining. The city itself is alright, as there is an abundance of police activity on campus that makes going to school a little worrisome. There have also been some instances where students or even people I knew personally have been harassed by other students or people living around the area. I'd love to see more student safety on campus and for that the administration would have to take suggestions from its students. Overall though, I've had a great time at Cal and I'm excited to spend more time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at UC Berkeley so far has been a positive one. The Professors and overall academics as an English major has been wonderful. I feel that I am rigorously challenged but the support that I receive makes the challenge doable. However, the one thing that I will critque is the safety of the surrounding area. While UC Berkeley campus is relativly safe, the city surrounding it is not.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a Physics/Math student, I think research opportunities at Berkeley are fantastic. There are a lot of opportunities in all fields/topics. For Physics, especially experimental physics/cosmology, LBL of great opportunities. For Math, SL-Math (MSRI) is one of the most renowned institutes. 

For Math, there're many course options & great flexibility, and also nice special topic courses & seminars.
The course options of Physics are much limited, but as a big public university, there are still plenty. The flexibility of physics department is not great. 

In terms of administration, Math is nice & efficient, while physics is much strict & bureaucratic. The university administration can be rather confusing and bureaucratic, and it has serious financial problems and that lead to lack of competent administrators. The university also has severe location constraint, which the rent is very high, and all spaces on campus are extremely expensive to rent for any student/department events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked how the professors were understanding of my condition when I needed an extension, I think that the food there is also very good. I would like to add that this is one of the best universities that I know of.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: It takes a while to adjust and while its interesting, it's extremely oppressive and tough academically at times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at UC Berkeley was characterized by rigorous academics that, while challenging, equipped me with the skills to handle pressure in my current industry. The university offered a diverse range of organizations and niches, allowing me to find my own community and interests. While safety was generally acceptable, it was something to stay mindful of during my time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is an academically rigorous institution with a beautiful campus and city life. I have personally enjoyed my time here at Cal and have made lifelong friends through my classes and athletics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love my experience at UC Berkeley. The amount of people I have met, the diversity of culture and thought is incredible. All the PhD students there are also very willing to help. 
Campus is also beautiful and the college sport experience is great
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I overall enjoy the cal experience. the people and area are vert nice. the professors are kinds most of the time but there are defiantly some bad ones in the batch. the advisors and other resources are hard to reach at times but when available they are great
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley offers a college experience that I am convinced is totally unique to other campuses. It gives you the opportunity to be an adult like no other environment. The academics are incredibly rigorous on their own, but this means you have to join clubs and organizations to stay afloat. It sounds bad that you have to in order to get by, but you do, and you quickly realize you would have kicked yourself if you didn't. There is such incredible diversity in the things you can do here, from fashion shows to formula 1 engineering, you name it. The community is so vibrant and beautiful and the area is so rich with culture, you will want to grow old here. I just wish the food and housing was better, because then it would be perfect.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a great school it's very strong academically. The campus is beautiful but the food is not the best
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: When people ask about my experience I usually say something along the lines of "it's a unique place to go to school." While the academics and faculty are phenomenal, the school culture can create much division and hostility between students. For a school that is so adamant about free speech, there still seems to be a lack of respect for other people's opinions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Some things that I like about UC Berkeley is that the professor are extremely dedicated in teaching the subject of the course and it is evident that they care about what they are teaching. Another thing that I like is how the university if located in the bay which are full of nice views. Additionally, UC Berkeley is full of courses which serves as a opportunity to learn something new for instance, I took a taekwondo class. Yet, I would like to see more diversity and more spaces (buildings) where students can study.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I turned into an adult during my four years at UCB. This university is a great option for students transferring into their upper division studies. The Graduate Student Instructors (GSIs) are usually more helpful than the profs. During lower division years, you will be hard pressed to find good academic resources/support. Undergrad teaching assistant do not get paid evenly across courses. If you teach in Chem or Eng, you could make a good salary, while TAing in Public Health was not compensated at all. I know this led to a class action lawsuit recently, proving that payment shouldn't be so disparate across disciplines.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The quality of professors are pretty variable, and the classes are lottery system which is somewhat annoying. Also there's a lot of crime off campus which is a little worrying. The campus food is alright, not as bad as people say but not the best either. Lots of clubs and academic rigor though, so there's definitely a lot of support for future career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great time at this university. I was accepted to Cal as a freshman and lived in the dorms, where I met some of my closest friends for the next 4 years. I got in as a Public Health major, but during my freshman year I developed an interest for Economics. I then pursued a double major along with a minor in Data Science. Throughout my journey I was involved with many clubs on campus as an executive, such as the Healthcare Business Association at Berkeley, the Cal Pakistani Students Association, and the Cal Muslim Students Association. I highly recommend anyone to attend this university, you will really develop yourself into the best version you could be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Berkeley is situated in a beautiful location with wonderful weather, however the environment is not very safe. I have been assaulted twice in two separate occasions when walking to school. I believe there can be more security measures taken by the school to better protect students and faculty. There are certain resources offered to accompany student, such as bear walk, however this is not always available or convenient. 
For academics, I believe professors can be more understanding of students and be more accessible in terms of communicating.
Furthermore, Berkeley is a bit expensive to live in. Housing and food are certainly costly. This can certainly be financially difficult for some students and may possibly create a stressful environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wish dining hall food was better quality and dorms could be for 2 years - social life is what you make of it if you want to meet people outside of your dorms join clubs, sports, and activities
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy the atmosphere of UC Berkeley however our dining hall food and housing situation can be improved. The classes are interesting but being in very large class sizes can be difficult. It can also be difficult to enroll in the classes you need because of how quickly they fill up. Additionally, walking around after the sun sets can be intimidating due to the high number of unhoused people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university is great, and academically rigorous. The safety is fine day to day, and there are tons of student organizations to join.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: To me, the variety of sources and opportunities offered by such a big campus. As a public university, Berkeley appeared more open to newly emerging affairs and is less stubborn than maybe other campuses. By accepting innovative methods/concepts, UCB broadens the options that students have to choose from. For example, UCB offers certain majors and minors that are relatively new, which other more conventional schools may not have).  This, in addition with the big student body (which incorporates a great diversity, thereby gathering the “elites” in all different fields. By that I mean really professional students  in different fields, the ones that I’ve explored include film, dance, musical,etc.) creates a huge platform for students to engage in some of the worldly high class professionals in almost any field one can think of.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors and academics are great. The overall academic culture at UC Berkeley is incredible and living in the Bay Area is great!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a freshman at UC Berkeley, my experience has been incredibly enriching. The academic excellence here is unparalleled, with top-notch professors and a stimulating learning environment. The diverse and inclusive community has been a highlight, allowing me to connect with peers from all backgrounds. The campus itself is beautiful, and its location in the vibrant San Francisco Bay Area offers endless cultural and recreational opportunities.

However, there are areas that could improve. The high cost of living in the Bay Area makes finding affordable housing challenging. Additionally, some of my introductory classes are quite large, which can be overwhelming and makes it harder to get personalized attention. Navigating administrative processes can be frustrating at times due to inefficiencies. Overall, UC Berkeley is an amazing place to study and grow, but addressing these issues would enhance the experience even more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my first year at Berkeley. There are many safety concerns in the area that I would like to see be changed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is a campus that provides its students with an inexplicable amount of opportunities. These opportunities extend beyond the academic sense but range across the work force, student life, resources, and more. I am very grateful to be able to attend such a university!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think UC Berkeley has been great overall regarding educational quality and opportunities. However, there could be some change regarding housing, as there is a huge shortage, food, which is often inconsistent in quality, and safety, given the urban challenges of the area surrounding campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is a prestigious institution that has a lot to offer in academics and extracurriculars. To me, the people are what make the experience so great, and fortunately, with such a large class, there is a myriad of people and groups to be affiliated with which illustrates the diversity at Berkeley. Some things can be frustrating sometimes such as applying for classes, finding resources, and having intrapersonal interactions with professors and classmates due to Berkeley being such a large institution. Additionally, there are other inconveniences such as the lack of housing for students which in my opinion, needs to start being a priority for the administration. Overall, UC Berkeley has a lot to offer and it is truly what you make of it. As someone who is heavily involved in varsity athletics, extracurriculars, leadership positions, and paraprofessional organizations, I am proud to call UC Berkeley home for me and I carry that with pride and class. Go Bears!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: As someone growing up in the suburbs, the hustle-and-bustle and business of the college student-city life of Berkeley, it was definitely a shift in environment that came like a shock. With areas that were less safe and a spike in crime, safety suddenly was at the forefront of my mind on the daily. I always had to be on alert in the surroundings around campus. Besides this initial shock, the academic life at UC Berkeley pushed me to become a better student and I truly found the greatest motivation to learn everything I could and take advantage of what the university had to offer. Additionally, if you are from a small town, Berkeley is definitely a city of great diversity, with students from so many different backgrounds with unique experiences and perspectives. The campus will really open your mind to what the world is truly like, and you will be able to find your own community, regardless of your own background.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Terrible institution. The professors are ok; however, the staff members of this institution are very deceptive. I had a very terrible experience attending this university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the diversity and the vibrant culture of UC Berkeley. It's such a big school that everyone has their own place. I'm so grateful to be able to attend this school. The only thing I would change is the safety aspect. The surrounding areas aren't safe, so never walk alone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: i'm gonna be an incoming freshman and i ended up choosing berkeley over other competitive schools because of their engineering programs and the amount of resources they have for students!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Attending UC Berkeley has been an amazing experience. The university provides a wide range of resources for students, from state-of-the-art research facilities to extensive libraries and diverse student organizations catering to almost every interest. The professors are not only knowledgeable but also genuinely invested in their student's success, offering valuable mentorship and opportunities for academic and professional growth.
However, some areas could be improved. While the campus is diverse, more initiatives are needed to foster a more inclusive environment, particularly in terms of support and representation for underrepresented groups. Additionally, the bureaucracy can sometimes be overwhelming, making it difficult for students to navigate administrative processes efficiently. More streamlined systems and increased support for student mental health and well-being would significantly enhance the overall experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being in Berkeley has allowed me to explore outside what I've known to be home my whole life. As someone coming from the suburbs, I had to grow accustomed to walking around the campus and the city as driving a car is less convenient but it's been good to experience something new. Additionally, college life has been exciting by far: meeting diverse groups of people, taking inspiring and eye-opening classes, studying with friends and exploring the city. However, what I would like to see change is the way the university uses its money. The university tries to minimize using its money to provide more classes for more student support--all the administrators are concerned about is gaining as much money in their pockets as possible and students have tried advocating for this change over the years yet the university remains largely complacent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Berkeley because of how diverse it is. Also, the location is awesome because there are so many places to explore especially because we are next to San Francisco. The campus is beautiful and full of history. A down side is we are definitely prioritize academics which cause to our social lives to be a bit unbalanced. We are also is a housing crisis like always. Overall I love it though!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think the culture here is very valuable and being surrounded by diverse people. Love participating in all sorts of clubs and events. Not everything is great and tuition is too much, housing is difficult, but I'm enjoying it. Love the city of berkeley and being in the bay!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience has been great at Berkeley. I love the school and its many opportunities as well as the friends I’ve made during my first year. I  also on the football team which has give me an extra set of us into athletics and that journey as also been amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a tough school academically. Your GPA will not be what it was in high school and you will probably be studying way more hours. However, this is an amazing school where I have met my forever friends. It exposed me to so many amazing people who have supported my academic career too and I am so grateful to all the professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first year at Cal was eyeopening. For the first time I was surrounded by fellow students who genuinely enjoyed learning biological sciences for the knowledge rather than for a letter grade. These same peers pushed me every single day through their hardened work ethics, collaborative mindsets and diverse viewpoints which collectively shaped me into a different person in just a span of 9 months. This first year taught me to advocate for myself in taking charge of the education I want to receive and controlling what I want to get out of this degree. I became proactive in attending healthcare seminars which hosted outside speakers, reaching out to industry professionals in medicine to chat and taking initiative in student run clubs to get the most out of all of the resources available on our Campus. Finally one of the most rewarding experiences was learning from the Senior class students who are going into healthcare related professions and asking them questions about their time at Cal.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very good, I would say if you want a strong academic experience it's definitely here and the same thing about social, very good place to choose what you want
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors were great and enthusiastic about what they were teaching about. Campus is gorgeous and has lots of nature.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: great overall. as a freshman, lots of opportunities were available. professors are approachable and kind.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley offers a vibrant academic environment with renowned faculty and diverse student body. Its emphasis on social activism fosters passion and purpose among students. However, challenges include program competitiveness and large class sizes. The campus's historic architecture and bustling atmosphere provide ample opportunities for involvement in clubs and research. Despite these, infrastructure issues like housing and transportation persist. Overall, UC Berkeley provides a dynamic setting for learning and growth, attracting students globally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: UCBerkeley is a fun and academically challenging university. You are learning from amazing professors and some of the most knowledgable individuals in their fields. You can find a social life that fits you perfectly, the party scene, organizations and overall experience is what you make of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The faculty possesses extensive knowledge and professionalism. The caliber of our academic curriculum is of the highest standard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is an incredible place. The people and teachers are amazing. You can learn so much! One thing however I strongly feel they need to improve on is their campus safety.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley was an incredible learning experience, I would say that the toxic competitiveness is quite the turn off and can make it almost next to impossible to collaborate on tasks with other students due to grade deflation. However, this school has endless oppurtunities and some of the brightest minds in the world teaching. The research is top notch. I would say that the school does pride itself on diversity yet is not so diverse. I wish to see Berkeley welcome students from all backgrounds and walks of life. There is a bit of a problem with nepotism, but most prestigious schools tend to have that problem as is. Bay Area is a great place to live as well so as a student it was easy to explore and get out (except during midterm or finals szn because you'd be locked in mainstacks - main library)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus was absolutely beautiful, the students were friendly, and the variety of different classes allows for exploring your interests. I would like to see change within the campus safety. There were constant threats and violence that I would receive emails about. Maybe if there was more strict campus protocols, less unlawful acts would take place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: it's been solid. Classes are super hard but I am learning a ton and can see this school helping me be successful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Berkeley was profoundly positive. Each school possesses its own distinctive personality, and Berkeley stands out for its constant engagement with societal issues. The university maintains a steadfast connection with the broader community, addressing pressing social concerns head-on. Students at Berkeley are remarkably passionate about effecting meaningful change in the world. Whether through activism, research, or community involvement, there's an undeniable drive among students to make a difference. Berkeley fosters an environment where such aspirations are nurtured and supported, instilling in its students a sense of purpose and a commitment to contributing positively to society.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Berkeley challenged me academically, socially, mentally, emotionally and even physically - all welcomed challenges as it forced me to grow and shape up into a more confident and eloquent individual. 
I was able to connect with widely diverse peers (now friends with whom I still interact) and even receive one-on-one time with my professors (many of whom I think of fondly). Teaching staff was consistently helpful, responsive and even kind to me as a student. I deeply enjoyed zooming through a beautiful campus to get to class. 
The one aspect of life at Berkeley I wish was different was the lack of safety on and near campus. Almost daily email alerts about another assault or theft would demoralize me. I always moved through campus on high alert, which added stress to an already stressful environment. 
Overall, I will always cherish my time at UC Berkeley and I feel deeply blessed to have attended.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley has a very unique student body with many people trying to excel. At first it may be a little overwhelming but with time you really get in the groove of being a Berkeley student
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience at the University of California Berkeley have been amazing. It was hard trying to adjust after moving 400+ miles away from home but Berkeley made it easy. I got to found my community and settled in easy.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Berkeley and don't regret my choice to come at all, but it's hard in every possible way. Housing isn't guaranteed at all. If you do get housing as a freshman, there's a decent chance you'll get put in a temporary room - a lounge room converted into a quad - at the same cost as a standard room, and with the stipulation that the university may reclaim the room at any point throughout the year. The off-campus housing market is cutthroat, and it's not uncommon for groups to offer to pay ~$1,000 more a month in rent to outbid other contenders.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a wonderful city with lots of great food and a dynamic environment! It does take a while to get used to, but after you do, there's so many great places to explore! There are a lot of on campus resources and opportunities, you simply have to be proactive and search for them yourself, especially since everything is so competitive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are rigorous, but that’s expected at a top institute. Many resources for research and underrepresented communities. Unsafe area, social life is what you make of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Berkeley is an absolutely amazing place to go to school. The campus is very unique in that each building has its own distinct style. While there is a very strong campus culture, and you can almost always find people there (unlike some other campuses that can often feel dead), you still feel very integrated into the surrounding city. This is probably due to the fact that the dorms are not on campus (although they are right across the street), and students only live in the dorms for 1 year, making it so that most students are living off-campus in the city. Depending on your preference, this could be a negative or a positive, but overall I would say it is a positive because most of the time it is usually just one or the other.

Personally, I would have preferred to have dorms on campus and stay there all 4 years, but I do think that my experience better prepared me for life after college. The only other downside I can say about the campus is that it is a bit hilly.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Berkeley. It's the right mix of academics, and social life. There's always something going on. The people who crap on Cal are people who don't know how to make friends and don't leave their room. It's just like real life--social life isn't going to come to you, you have to get yourself out there and not be a freaking weirdo. Academics are pretty difficult, but there's help if you seek it out. That's the thing. Everything you need is there, it's just that nobody is there to give it to you. Grow up and seek stuff out on your own. Your mom's not here to hold your damn hand anymore. ANYWAYSSSS I love Cal. peace
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a rough start at Berkeley as a transfer student because while they accept lots of transfer students, the university is really designed for four-year students. But once I was settled into my classes and found a good group of friends, I began to enjoy it and can't imagine having gone anywhere else for undergrad. I think the experience you have is largely dependent on your willingness to take part in your classes, be open to learning new things outside of your comfort zone, and being social enough to find friends to help get you through college. Study something you're passionate about, but also take as many classes outside of your major as you can because there are so many interesting classes offered at Berkeley and it's an amazing space to broaden your horizons.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience. I wish I can rewind time and do it again. I would choose attend Berkeley again. Housing is always a challenge but I was never homeless!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley was an incredible experience and i am honored to have been able to graduate from this world-renowned institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Berkeley this year has been a mix of excitement and culture shock. As a student from a small town, coming to a large and diverse university like Berkeley was a big change for me. However, I have been able to find my footing and make the most of my experience. The campus itself is beautiful and offers a plethora of resources for students. However, as a Latinx student, it was initially challenging to find a sense of community. Fortunately, I have joined several clubs where I have found a supportive and welcoming Latinx community. The professors at Berkeley have also been very considerate and genuinely care for their students. However, the campus surroundings were a bit of a shock, as there is a high level of crime and homelessness in the area. While I wouldn't say it's unsafe, it is important to be cautious when walking around at night. Overall, my experience at Berkeley has been eye-opening and has allowed me to grow as an individual.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is very academically resourceful. The main problems we faced in recent years are safety issues and housing shortages with high rent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley had very good professors and offered a wide variety of classes for different interests. Most classes were the style where students just listened to the teacher lecture and could ask some questions at the end but otherwise had little interaction with the lecturer. However, most classes required discussion sections which allowed students to get help from graduate student assistants and have an open space to talk with classmates about what was being taught. There were a good amount of food options around the campus area but there were also a lot of empty spaces. The campus's cafeterias did not offer the best quality food. The campus and surrounding area felt unsafe at times with random people walking up to ask for money while I was on campus, a person running on campus while on fire, a school shooting scare, an actual shooting outside one of the dorms, and other incidents. My first year was fully online because of the pandemic and my second year I was denied housing in the dorms.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is such an amazing environment. Unlike many other schools the entire city is oriented towards students and student life. There are a lot of various types of foods but mostly a lot of Asian foods. Academically though there is grade deflation, Berkeley professors, especially psych professors, are extremely helpful and accomodating
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: From an academic standpoint, UC Berkeley is an outstanding school. Academics are rigorous, and there are many opportunities for extracurricular achievement if you seek them out. Great school for ambitious and driven individuals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the independence and freedom that being a college student comes with. I've had a good time at Berkeley and have made a lot of friends. I am pretty involved in school and clubs, and overall it has been an amazing experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley gives you the best of both worlds - strong academic and a full college / social experience. I've been challenged by not only classes, but clubs and extracurricular activities that prepare you for professional careers. The party and social scene are also great - there are many groups and communities you can choose to be part of since it's such a big school. Some downsides are that the Berkeley town and surrounding areas might not be the safest. You will likely need to take precautions when getting around. However, the food scene around campus is amazing and there are lots of activities you can do within 15-min drive from campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice campus great people, chill surrounding area with beautiful scenery and roadtrips but the city is not safe unfortunately a lot of incidents
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a profound place for an individual to pursue their education and passions. It is one the topic public school in the country, and filled with young adults and educators with so many vibrant personalities and knowledge in the realms of their minds. However, I believe that the campus life could be more safe and the housing issues definitely need to be improved upon, as many students are struggling with safety concerns and fear of not having housing from their second year all the way to their last year of completion.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a diverse area with a rich, campus life, full of students from all cultural backgrounds. Immersing myself in the many student-run organizations, Berkeley has taught me how different ways of thinking can mix together to create something beautiful, whether that be an engineering project or a dance choreography. The city, however, is nowhere close to perfect, and the students are trapped in a grim, dangerous environment where active shooters, violent criminals, and the homeless roam the streets. I have even encountered an active shooter on campus where a weapon was pulled out in front of my face.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my time at Berkeley. There is an atmosphere of inclusion and celebration of diversity. I have the most amazing professors who make me love learning! I am majoring in Molecular Environmental Biology with a minor in African American Studies. I am hoping to become a medical doctor and I know my time at Berkeley is pushing me to reach that goal. Being in a city is new to me, there is always something exciting happening and something to see. Being able to see the Berkeley Hills and the Golden Gate Bridge when I wake up is amazing. Not to mention that the people I have met here push me to be a better person and inspire me. There are many organizations to join, so far I have joined Berkeley Engineers And Mentors (BEAM), Cal Surf Rider, greek life and the women's club water polo team. There is something for everyone, and for every version of myself aspire to be. I am grateful to be learning and living at UC Berkeley ! GO BEARS!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is a great place for students to learn about the reality of the world and inequalities. UC Administration is incredibly conservative and prioritizes profit over student health, safety or academics. It takes thick skin to go to Berkeley because you will likely feel inferior in every way. Imposter syndrome is a part of the acceptance. But if you are there, you are meant to be. Don't let the pretentious students or elitest tenured professors make you feel like you're not meant to be there. Berkeley should prioritize students and not outdated tenured professors who don't know how to teach, but are only faculty because they are there for research. I wish I knew the school didn't care about the students, you have to care about yourself or you will drown here. But it does teach you about the reality of the world since there is no hand holding, you get thrown in the deep end and either sink or swim. Good luck!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I liked going to UC Berkeley and am glad I did my undergrad degree there! The academics were very difficult, and the academic environment could feel competitive, but there were also lots of resources. I liked being part of a college where most students lived nearby but off-campus; the experience helped me foster a lot of independence and learn about myself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The main problem I have for Berkeley is that the safety of our campus is concerning. The nightlife here is threatened by the safety of walking after sunset. The diversity here is the main thing I like, there are many people with whom we can meet and share our commonalities. The professors here seem more professional with a wider range of knowledge from different fields which can provide more advice to students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school offering various academic and career opportunities, but the campus and classrooms are crowded, and housing is expensive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I Have so far loved my experience at UC Berkeley. I was very worried at first since I originally am from Southern California, so it took me a few weeks to be able to get comfortable being so far from home. I love the courses and how nice all the professors and graduate student instructors are. Every one is very accommodating and whoever I would talk to them about my stresses in their classes, they would continuously work through it with me. There was also the free tutoring for students which helped grow my confidence as well. I just overall felt like I had an amazing support grow when I first started coming here and still now I do. 

there's not much that I would like to see change, I feel that every aspect of UC Berkley is always getting better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that the professors here are really diverse and love teaching their field of study. One thing I would like to see improved would be the way in which resources and information is available or distributed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: NICHE MUST HATE BERKELEY!!! berkeley is an amazing school. Amazing academics, faculty, administration, etc. I am a DSP student majoring in Economics, and I am so happy that I attend here. It's challenging and not inclusive all the time, but if you work hard for it, you can make the most out of it. GO BEARS!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Life at UC Berkeley is intense and engaging. Expect to be surrounded by diverse, passionate students from all backgrounds, all with their own unique ideas and goals. The academic scene is challenging, demanding late-night study sessions and critical thinking. But outside the classroom, there's a vibrant energy that makes Berkeley more than just books. From lectures by Nobel laureates to casual debates at Sproul Plaza, there's always something new to learn and someone new to connect with. You'll find communities dedicated to everything imaginable, pushing your boundaries and expanding your horizons in unexpected ways. The Berkeley experience can be demanding, but it's also transformative. You'll emerge feeling empowered, confident, and part of something bigger than yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is a community-oriented school with a gorgeous campus. It provides the highest standards in education, with endless resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors, curriculum, and clubs here are all fantastic- what you expect from Berkeley. The admin can be bureaucratic though as it's a large public university, but you'll learn to adapt for the real world after graduating, so it's ultimately good too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great classes, the large size can be tricky to navigate at first but gets better with time. I didn't think that I would love the strong sports culture, but I have been enjoying the sports games and school spirit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is really just beautiful. I love the old vibes that the buildings give and the Campanile at night is so nice to see from the balcony of my dorm building. Academically, I love all my professors so far and truly feel like I am improving as a person, an academic, and a young adult finding her place in the workplace.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the open campus and the ability to be on campus when needed even if it's late at night. I love how close then campus is to my dorm as well as the other dorms in place. Academically I love that this college teaches beyond the subject at hand and how they incorporate as much information on what's going round in the world today. Overall, I love the traditional aspect and how liberal this school is, it really enables you to seek beyond an education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduating CS major, I've had an incredible experience at UC Berkeley. I've taken fantastic courses across CS, EE, and other departments that provided in-depth foundations for my technical growth. The opportunities to join world-class research labs allowed me to pursue various ML projects. I was also involved in a variety of technology clubs and social clubs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Embarking on the digital adventure at Berkeley has been an absolute blast! The flexibility and convenience of online classes are like a magic wand, letting me dance through my coursework while juggling life's other adventures. With Berkeley's virtual toolbox filled with interactive resources and a vibrant global community, my laptop became a portal to a world of diverse knowledge and perspectives.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending UC Berkeley has been an enriching experience that aligns perfectly with my passion for environmental economics and policy. The university's program not only caters to my academic interests but also provides exceptional opportunities for undergraduate research. Engaging in hands-on projects and studies has allowed me to delve deeper into the complexities of environmental issues while honing my analytical and problem-solving skills.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: While it is a very well known school, I don't think the education it provides students actually lives up to its name. Many of the times, the class average is so low that professors would have a crazy curve just so that 80% of the class doesn't fail (but I guess that's every prestigious school). The area around it is very sketchy making it unsafe for students who have classes during the evening. Majority of the classrooms have no ac/heaters and very little ventilation. I was honestly surprised that it didn't violate any health codes. However, that being said, I do enjoy the various food places nearby and the cute small shops that are available. Because Berkeley is basically just a small little college town, you really can walk everywhere and it overall is just very convenient.
