GSIs are very friendly and always willing to help to the best of their abilities and many stem majors provide various resources for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Something I like about UC Berkeley is the variety of classes they have with amazing instructors. As well as the beautiful scenery. However, something I would like to see change is more financial help. Also, a change for the housing crisis.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: At UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business, undergraduates delve into a dynamic blend of rigorous academics and practical application. Engaging with renowned faculty, students explore a holistic curriculum encompassing business fundamentals, ethics, and innovation. Collaborative projects and experiential learning opportunities foster leadership skills and a global perspective. The vibrant campus culture encourages diverse thinking and networking, complemented by industry connections and guest lectures. Haas undergraduates benefit from a supportive community, innovative programs, and resources that empower them to navigate real-world challenges and emerge as versatile, socially responsible leaders in the competitive business landscape.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wish there was more teacher support who are willing to help and I also wish that they didn't have the impacted majors policy as I have experienced so much anxiety over it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley stands as an esteemed academic institution celebrated for its top-tier faculty, diverse community, and robust research initiatives. Renowned for its academic prestige, the university offers a rich environment for learning and growth. The campus's commitment to diversity and inclusivity fosters a vibrant and dynamic student body, while its location in the Bay Area provides unparalleled opportunities for professional development and cultural exploration. However, addressing concerns about criminal activity in the surrounding area remains pivotal to ensure the safety and well-being of the campus community, necessitating proactive measures and collaboration with local authorities to create a secure environment for all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I studied art and loved the experimental and conceptual bent of the art department. I also enjoyed living in the Clark Kerr dorms.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I visited this university and I was stunned at how beautiful it was. It's a beautiful campus with very friendly people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of California - Berkeley is an amazing institution. It is such a diverse community with everyone pushes each other to grow. Ever since I got into Berkeley, within just a few months, I have already seen how much I have grown as a person.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's been really great. I love campus, the professors are enthusiastic and really care about teaching us. It's helped me to be more organized and have a great disposition. I've met so many wonderful people from around the world, getting great perspectives and broadening my mind.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a big school so it was a little difficult to transition into my freshman year, but once I looked at the different resources and organizations the university offered, I loved it! It's really important to get involved while you're there. I was involved in different pre-law organizations, ASUC, Cal Cheerleading, and others and it was a great experience. It's a little difficult getting classes especially in your first or second year, but once you declare your major it's a lot easier. My major advisor Lauri is the best. She's super helpful and has made my time at Berkeley a lot easier. I would like to see an easier way for students to enroll to classes they need easier. I would also like for the university to recognize cheer as a sport so cheerleaders can have access to academic accommodations, as they are at all the sports events and have hours of practice per week.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I felt nervous when I first came to school because all of my classes were online during the pandemic. After attending UC Berkeley I needed to readjust to the face-to-face mode. I felt so warm and welcoming here, and all the mentors were very friendly during the GBO event at orientation. They introduced the school and gave us a lot of advice about living on campus. In terms of study, I feel the difficulty of university studies and the importance of self-study. However, the students were willing to help each other and the TAs were very helpful in solving our problems. The school has a lot of resources and the library provides a lot of equipment for us to use.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: A popular, well-funded university, with tons of opportunities and support systems for all types of students. The downside, it is a large school, so sometimes you can get lost in the crowd, feel moments of imposter syndrome, etc. However, if you find your people and utilize the available support systems, it can quickly become a place of growth and transformation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, most professors are great. However some professor rely heavily on graduate student instructors which make grades unfair sometimes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Coming to UC Berkeley was an emotional investment. As a freshman, I combatted imposter syndrome as I found it impossible to succeed in general STEM classes and join academic clubs - even finding housing was a struggle. As I have grown into my place at Berkeley I have become immensely more assertive, outgoing, and confident in my academic and interpersonal skills. While I knew that choosing UC Berkeley would set me up for a series of academic challenges, I found myself questioning aspects of myself that have ultimately led me to grow into the person I am. I will never regret choosing this university and I am eternally grateful for the lasting life skills it has presented me with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Life changing experience. I would recommend anyone to go. Challenging course, and I did my master in Harvard. Some Berkeley kids are much brighter than Harvard kids.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
An Amazing School...Academically Strong Faculty and Supporting TA/RAs There’s the classic academic method that I learned........
This is one of the most beautiful campuses I've ever seen. The landscape creates a breathtaking experience. We were there for the open house in April and everything was well planned out, as well as enticing. I would recommend checking this campus out if you're in town.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review:
UC- Berkeley has allowed me grow in ways I would've never imagined. It has allowed me to meet people that have opened doors for me, people that I have created memories with and that have made an impact on me. Although it can get hard at times there is always people you can count on for help including professors,  staff and faculty. 

One thing I do wish would change is the online learning, my first year was all online and it make it very difficult to learn and participate but with such a drastic change i think they did a very good job.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Attending the University of California, Berkeley is an unparalleled experience that can be described as nothing short of transformative. From its academic rigor to its vibrant campus culture, UC Berkeley offers students a remarkable journey of growth, discovery, and personal development.

Berkeley is renowned for its academic excellence. As a student, you'll have the privilege of learning from some of the brightest minds in the world. The university's distinguished faculty members are pioneers in their respective fields, and they're passionate about imparting knowledge and fostering intellectual curiosity. The academic programs are comprehensive and diverse, providing opportunities for students to explore a wide range of subjects and disciplines.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy the hollistic style of learning that is encouraged through our General Education requirements. Students are able to build close connections to professors and GSI's as well as other students through office hours, and discussion sections and there is a dialogue of conversation and revision in the pedagogy.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Awesome chemistry program! However, the way that they get you to grow is by pushing you to your absolute limits, great for learning but it sometimes can hurt one's mental health.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics live up to the expectations - rigorous, but very fulfilling in terms of the like-minded peers, faculty, and opportunities a UC Berkeley education and association bring. However, on-campus dorming quality, the campus safety, and the parking fees and acccessibility can be improved upon to create a safer, accessible environment for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a transfer and reentry student at UC Berkeley.  I felt awkward going into school being older. However the school has great communities and resources for older students with children. The classes are great the professors are caring and knowledgeable. I have loved my experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at berkeley has been like no other because i have continued to be challenged in day to day life that i did have before i got here. Coming here i had severe imposter syndrome because i was raised in a small town int he central valley and i was no where near as smart as everyone else. However going into my second year i understand that everyone has different backgrounds and that i am here for a reason.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everything close and easy to get to without a car. Good communication from the dorm staff and lots of clubs and groups.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is a prestigious university with great educational experience. However, there’s little to no help for students and there seems to be a lot of religious/ racial discrimination.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: At first the school wasn’t my first choice but it was the most affordable. After my first year I realized it was the perfect fit for me. I was able to become more independent and find community and have access to opportunities I’ve never had before. I would say the biggest downside is housing. I am currently in a panic applying to scholarships because I was luckily able to fine a really great housing deal for next semester, but I only have enough in my savings for two months rent. My work study job only pays $300 a month, year rent is over $1000. I just need money to help cover the cost of housing since I am low-income and my family cannot afford to assist me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley is amazing. The crime is not as bad of a problem as people make it out to be. There’s the occasional worrisome Warn Me notification but it’s just as bad as it would be in any other urban area. The campus is beautiful and the night life is wonderful around campus. The dorms are well maintained for the most part and overall the campus and housing are very social and friendly places :)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the social aspect and clubs. The professors overall are great and the location also, east to get around
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Students are very intellectually active. Most of my classmates are invested in their field of study and because they're so academically motivated, their passion for their field of study helps you as a student to also stay motivated. Professors are also very engaged and passionate about their topic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love UC Berkeley so far. Although I am only a freshman I can already see the opportunities this university has to offer to me. The campus is also a plus. It is a beautiful place with a beautiful community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: They never let me give up going back to college and achieving my goals. Then have a excellent teaching staff and their are always there for you. The curriculum is outstanding.  They are the elite of education for biblical studies.  The campus is beautiful and their food is very good. They even gave me a scholarship to help me pay for my tuition fees and they guided me all the way.  The webinar was excellent we met other students in our field of study.  Along with professors and the administration staff. It was very enlighten and exciting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, the experience has been generally very good. The school is expensive in comparison with other UCs and they like to add additional fees without telling you that they need to be paid. The classes seem like they are going to be very engaging and it is possible to have smaller classes with good planning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley has been great at providing free resources ranging from mental health, sexual violence, medical resources, safety, financial, and academic. The school spirit is also much better compared to other schools. It does feel a little unsafe but you should be fine as long as you travel down busy roads or with other people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very crowded and stressful at times, dorms are not nice, area is not nice. However, stepping on campus is an unreal feeling and everything done thereon should be celebrated and deeply respected.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lot of clubs but the “good” ones are hard to get into and have a lengthy application process. Great chemistry department. Financial aid is difficult especially as an out of state student.  Very large school and sometimes finding appropriate resources is difficult.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I was a freshman, there were a lot of programs for me, such as the Summer Bridge Program, Golden Bear Orientation, etc., that my family and I didn't have to pay for. However, my second year right now doesn't have any programs like that yet for incoming Berkeley students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Despite the glory of getting a degree from UC Berkeley, the horrors of walking the streets of Telegraph and Bancroft have yet to cease their effects on my excitement to go back for my second year. UC Berkeley, during my first year of college, was full of curiosity but always left my mouth hanging agape...and not in a good way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the atmosphere, strong academic programs, vibrant campus life, and contributions to various fields, including science, technology, arts, and social sciences. It's renowned for its rigorous academics, innovative research, and diverse student body. At the same time quite stressful. Also, the grade deflation exist. It's a place where students from various backgrounds and cultures come together, fostering a rich and diverse community. Lastly, Berkeley has a reputation for fostering an environment that encourages creativity, entrepreneurship, and innovation. The proximity to Silicon Valley and the Bay Area's tech industry provides students with unique opportunities to engage in startups, technology, and innovation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkely is an amazing university. I suggest and recommend both of my friends and family to apply there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Berkeley, as an out-of-state student, is an extremely unique school. It was a stark contrast from my previous schooling experiences and I was met by a rude awakening. The school of course has its liberal reputation, however I did not expect it to be so abrupt. Overall, I do love the university, it simply took adapting to get used to, as any college does.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I start in the fall but so far I have been able to connect with the Cal Alumni Association and they have shown excitement and pride in my knowledge of the exclusion that African Americans and others of non-white descent feel on campus. I have met some kind educators and graduates who are of African descent and who admire my efforts to uplift the community of minorities on campus. I was able to tour the campus without having to pay for much, with that only being the bell tower. Berkeley is beautiful and an exciting place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like the school to reduce the level of prestige that many students are fed because it can lead them to be quite rude at times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have not fully experienced Berkeley considering I am about to start my freshman year in the fall. However, when visiting the campus during college visits, the campus was very welcoming and beautiful. The staff and students were encouraging and the environment was clean which inspired me to commit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is renowned for its academic excellence and intellectual rigor. The campus at UC Berkeley is known for its diversity and inclusive environment, fostering a rich cultural experience for students from different backgrounds. I myself have experienced this by having many opportunities of joining extracurriculars that align with my cultural and religious identity. UC Berkeley has a strong entrepreneurial culture, supporting students' innovative ideas and encouraging them to pursue entrepreneurial ventures. This includes joining clubs, organizations, and extracurricular activities that help students network and gain experience in their major and future career choice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a good school with a lot of resources if you find them. At first glance, UC Berkeley may seem overwhelming due to its sheer size and bustling atmosphere. Yet, beneath the surface lies a wealth of opportunities, programs, and services that are there for the taking, should you know where to look. The key to fully unlocking UC Berkeley's potential is to explore, ask questions, and embrace a proactive approach to discovering its resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Decent school, and full of entrepreneurial spirit. Lots of Whites, Asians, and internationals, and lots of clubs for every purpose imaginable. People are generally welcoming but in terms of friend groups and social relationships, there seems to be some underlying colorism present and POCs aren't as openly accepted in certain homogenous groups. Harder to put yourself out there but you are always rewarded for your persistence. Dining hall food isn't amazing, but they keep improving. Dorms for freshmen are overall at most decent, but housing for upperclassmen is very good. Lots of great opportunities to make a name for yourself and work with top tier researchers. This is a very much work hard play hard school with decent but overpriced eateries nearby and pretty close to where the action is. Stay safe by always carrying self defense tools on you. Good public transportation nearby.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I haven't been yet but so far the community is welcoming. I receive updates about different events and am active in the UC Berkeley  subreddit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the people I met at Berkeley, all the students and professors. Every student I met was kind and understood that we are all trying to study and graduate. There was no need to fight amongst each other. Additionally, all my professors were more than willing to help when it came to studying, or confusion with material. The only downside was the amount of time I had to do it all: study, socialize, research, and work a part-time job. There are plenty of student organizations and weekly activities. You meet wonderful people, and you have stories that you can only get at Berkeley. As for the downsides, such as living off campus, you had to manage your time to make the bus or have enough time to walk up the hill. A rainy day makes everything worse. I would like to homeless crisis change. I saw so many homeless people out at all times of the day. Not just in People's Park, but closer to Telegraph and Shattuck. Once you go past Hearst, or below Blake, the amount of homeless drops off.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: At UC Berkeley, I loved the sense of community and standing together. My first semester, many UC employees went on strike, despite this, they were all still very supportive of the students and understood the abruptness. Many students also stood alongside them. The reason I give it a 3/5 is because of some of the professors and the university's lack of acknowledging that they are not being fair or reasonable. I and many other students in the Disabled Students Program had our professor ignore our accommodations and when we said something about it, the school had said that the professors are not forced to follow them. Not only this, but some professors did not grade anything in a reasonable time. Many students in math classes especially struggled because they never knew what their grade truly was.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have only completed one year at Berkeley, but I have enjoyed it so far. The large population can be intimidating at the beginning, but you get used to it as the school year goes on. UC Berkeley is also known for its competitiveness in classes, clubs, and other things that are involved with the campus. Other than those things, there is a lot of school spirit, driven and talented students alike, and a community of everyone to find where they belong in such a big school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed the scenery and most of the nice facilities. I have been very disappointed with the lack of concern in my dorm for livable temperature conditions as my dorm has been 77-80 degrees for over a week and staff claims to have fixed the problem while it continues to worsen. There is also a sort of negative air toward POC (excluding Asian) students which is difficult to deal with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love my experience when going to UC Berkeley. Its very calm and I really love the scenery. Though going to one class to the other might be quite a challenge since you have to walk up those steep hills. But overall, one thing that could change is that not letting homeless get in on the classrooms or dormitories.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
UC Berkeley is known for its prestigious history and courses. It is an amazing place to learn and you can’t find an atmosphere quite like it. However, UC Berkeley is also crime-ridden, and they have either not-enough staff, or they accept to many students. Students will not have guaranteed housing, even as first-years, and they will experience delays in their financial aid and documentation status. There is not enough staff, very clearly, to manage residency forms, and end up charging legal California residents out-of-state tuition until they can prove themselves residents. They take their time—which financially affects many of their students. 

Dorms are unsafe and robbed often—students are forced to purchase additional security for themselves. Homeless people walk around campus doing crazy stuff, including but not limited to flashing students.

It’s a historic and beautiful campus. Staff is amazing and professors are fantastic. But this is a mess. Stress & anxiety plague Berkeley.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall Berkeley is a university where the professor that I have had, know what they are doing and push you do do your best. The lower-division class are very full and sometimes it can be stressful to sign up of classes because of the demand of it being a require majored class for many students. However, the professor that teach lower-division class are super helpful and want you to succeed so they use the point system instead of the student competing with each other. I like that the people there are welcoming, there is a variety of clubs that you can sign up for and they are always advertisers that are willing to help. Something that could be changed is more seating for students and better wifi.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors for my major classes are truly leaders of their fields and it was inspiring learning about their research that kept me interested in my major. Additionally, many of my professors and graduate student instructors were responsive and helpful when answering questions. Although the campus was different from my expectations I grew to love the natural aspects of the campus like the Eucalyptus Grove and Botanical Garden.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am in the summer bridge program and I can say the pathway has allowed me to make friends and connections. I feel way more prepared to enter into my Freshmen year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Berkeley is overall very positive! The campus is extremely nice and the city of berkeley is amazing to have surrounding the actual campus. Transportation is super easy which is a big bonus. Dorms and food are not good, but not actively terrible either. In terms of academics, some classes and teachers are super awesome, but of course there are some that are not, kind of a mixed bag.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a fun time in classes getting to interact with fellow students and learn from various professors. The GSIs are a great help in better understanding the subject of interest. The energy in the classroom is very engaging and there are many great spots to relax and study on the campus
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Most classes are very big so you won't receive individual attention. Take advantage of office hours and group sessions, they're invaluable. Remember to spend time destressing as well. Dorms are off campus so if you have late classes, walk with someone or at least be aware and with some form of defense ready as the area is not very safe. People's Park is filled with homeless individuals so be a little wary of it. Cafeteria food is not very good so prepare a meal budget because many students end up ordering food from restaurants and cafes near campus, quickly draining their wallets.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UC Berkeley is truly an exceptional university for any student. The campus itself is beautiful and the campus community is very lively with students always engaging in clubs and other extracurricular activities on top of their academics. Many of the professors I've had always came to class and taught from their heart and soul rather than just teaching to teach. Though most aspects of Berkeley are outstanding, I would want to see the music department and their Student Musical Activities improve. The Cal Band has a lot of instruments for its students to use, but the vast majority of these instruments are either very old or heavily weathered. I would also like to see Berkeley's music department and Student Musical Activities grow closer together. As it stands now, these two groups seem to be quite distant from each other even though both have a strong passion for music.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: So many students from Cal are in the Olympics!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I believe athletics and sports are a huge part of our school's highlights. Students are extremely spirited and devoted Golden Bears. From what I hear, our athletic facilities are generally in great quality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one is school treats someone different for the fact someone is greek. I have never seen or heard any discrimination against greek and non-greeks
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in a fraternity or sorority but many throw parties. However, there are different types; some are social frats/sororities, while others are professional ones.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very spirited and supportive when it comes to athletic sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
I'm biased because I am in Greek life, but it has had a great influence on my college career.  I am in a sorority where there are a wide range of women, many of whom thought they would never ever join a sorority.  There are girls who go to parties and drink, and girls who never do, and all of them are very studious. I think Berkeley Greek life breaks most stereotypes. While there may be the stereotypical rude blonde sorority girl or obnoxiously fratty guy here and there, there are many genuine people with interests and goals way beyond Greek life. I have made a lot of my best friends in my sorority, but still have friends outside of it through involvement on campus. 

There are also almost always parties on weekend nights and often small mixers on tuesday-thurs. The weekend parties range from 500 people themed ragers to mixers between one sorority and one frat. The only night where it might be hard to find people getting drunk is Monday. It is definitely harder to get in if you're a guy not in Greek life. 

Another plus to Greek life- The housing for women is awesome and generally a lot cheaper than dorms.. The frat houses are grimey but are fun because they're all on a real "greek row", which really adds to the collegiate atmosphere. Check out Piedmont Ave South of campus on google maps!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
I love going to a Pac-12 School because of the culture around sporting events and the amped up school spirit. Regardless of how much you care about the game, there are always events surrounding them, such as the Greek row day-ragers before every football game and the whole campus going all out for "Big Game Week" before our annual rivalry game with Stanford. The best part of the sports scene is there isn't a lot of pressure to be super into the technical aspect of the sport.  It's okay to just get drunk (or not) wearing blue and gold and screaming "Go Bears!"

As a non-athlete, it's fun to partake in the Pac-12 sports enthusiasm as well as use the facilities. The Rec Center (RSF) and the other gyms on campus are mostly well kept and open, and have regular work out classes available to anyone. The memberships are also free, which is a huge plus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people join Greek life for the community and most non-Greeks just go for the parties.

Student%20Life.Review: Intramurals are very popular and really fun! The workout facilities are average to good and you get free group exercise classes with your membership which is awesome.

Student%20Life.Review: There are a variety of people on campus that balances the overall diversity. Some people are exceptionally driven from their past academics, sports, music, or other achievements in their lives. Some people are here to fit into campus, as they felt like an outcast back in high school. And some people, are just here to have some fun. But whatever their main goal is, every person has some kind of belief in them that they live by, and creates a unique balance on campus. As a competitive karate athlete who devoted everything to academics and karate, I had a very narrow perspective when I first came to this school, because I felt that no one would understand my motivation, passion, pressure, stress, and the almost overwhelming joy that I feel from the sport. However, to be here at UC Berkeley, I learned that though it may be in many different shapes and/or forms of expression, that people all had an unique past will drive and passion to get here, and achieve amazing things in their lives now and in the future.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus holds a lot policies, and I  feel that the leniency of each policy have a good balance in the society. For instance, I feel that the campus's policy for alcohol use is fairly lenient, and that is a good thing, not because the under-aged students can drink, but because that is a decision that each individual should make at their own risk and responsibility. However, the campus has very strict policies and mentality towards racism, and I strongly agree with the fact how the school strongly supports beliefs that is for the best of most on campus.

Academics.Review:
1. IT'S HARD.

2. There are no "easy" majors. 

3. There are very, very few "easy" classes. The moment you treat it as an easy class, you'll fall behind and it'll suck.

4. Students here work so hard that we don't leave the library when we feel an earthquake. Whatever. It's NorCal. Earthquakes happen.

5. There was also an explosion in one of the vents on campus and people complained about leaving the library. WE NEED TO STUDY. WE TAKE IT SERIOUSLY.

6. Imagine 500 people in one class who were the top 10% of their high school class, and imagine adding a curve where only 15% of them will get an A. That's what the competition is like. Sink or swim, baby.

7. You will come out scarred but much, much tougher. No one will hand you your grades or resources, so you learn to be independent. That comes with being a highly-ranked public university - budget cuts make some resources (like advising, classes, library hours) harder to come by.

8. Regardless, it's still a rewarding experience. You'll be around Nobel Laureates, peers who are freaking geniuses, classes that blow your mind, and a long legacy of Cal pride.

Academics.Review:
Registration for classes is quite a pain.

Some professors are good, some are bad.

GSI: I have mixed reviews for the ones that I've had; there are some that teach way beyond the level of college freshman and expect us to catch on-- we don't, and they seem to not understand that. Others, you can tell definitely that they're only in for the financial aid they get from teaching. they put minimal effort into their job.

On the other hand, some GSIs are very enthusiastic and supportive. They extend office hours outside of school hours, try their best at making you understand by breaking things down, etc. Some understand how tired/ bored we are make things interesting which is always appreciated.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I love the biological sciences, but Molecular and Cell Biology is an intense major.  It is very difficult, but it can be done.  The sciences are extremely competitive, but that does not mean that you cannot beat the competition.  Make study groups, go to office hours, go to tutoring.  Do what you must do in order to perform well in the classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Berkeley does not play when it comes to academics.  Remember that you are NOT a high school student anymore.  It truly is a entirely different ball game.  It is not impossible, but much more difficult.  The academics can be intimidating, but you, the student, must take the appropriate steps to UNDERSTAND the material that is presented before you.  Go to tutoring, start a study group, go to office hours.  There are so many resources at Berkeley, but YOU must take advantage of them.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Professors are great very diverse and lovely to see how they vary from colleges. Curriculum is good, intense at times because of the workload and other extra curriculum activities that students usually handle. Registration for my college is well controlled and not too stressing if you do it when your registration phase is happening. You always have some homework to do or something to study for.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: There are many opportunities to apply to internships and to network with professionals because there are a series of career center events that occur specifically for this. Also in my college we have our own networking with professionals with our career center.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The classes for my major have been a great experience. I am always busy, but this is college right? The instructors have been good and I look forward to my next semester.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: A lot of the professors are wonderful. Academics can be super challenging but overall, I really like the education I get.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm only a first year and I just chose a major, so I can't really say yet.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Public Health is impacted so I have to apply to get in. I don't know what admission rates are but the process is pretty simple.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Internships are not propagated well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Internships are not propagated well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Thought-provoking, but professors sometime drab.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I love the classes and opportunities my major has on campus. I have a research position and it's loads of fun and education. The campus is big so lots of opportunity but you must stand out to get positions.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Academics here a tough, you can't mess around. The quality of lower division classes is questionable, but when you get a small class with one-on-one time around your professor, you realize that you're studying at the one of the world's best universities.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's amazing. Best professors. Hands on research.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: The faculty is doing world-class science and is actively trying to engage the undergraduates and the community in these efforts. Labs are easy to find research work in and the grad students are supportive and great resources.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: I love my program because it is very flexible and diverse but can be tailored to give great depth as well. The faculty are readily available for meetings and show up to coffee/happy hours ready to talk and interact with students. The facilities are sometimes lacking (the buildings are old) but the university is committed to improving them, albeit slowly. The workload can be overwhelming at times but it's manageable most of the time as long as you plan your classes well.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Some departments and programs are harder to get into than others. L&S is easy to get into, whereas the Engineering or Computer Science departments are more competitive to get in to.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Current cirriculum is very interesting and I am looking forward to what my next few years will entail.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: cal is the number one public university in the nation. students work hard and play hard here.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Pre-med/biological sciences are killer here. All the prereq classes made me very miserable - so i ended up changing my major to english. wish i had the courage to change out of science earlier, would have tried engineering or economics instead.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I am unpaid but have met many great people and built up experience
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: A unique program that many schools don't have and has already taught me many things
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Public Health majors have lots of interesting classes and opportunities for extra volunteering/work
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I highly recommend checking out at least one library to study in, even if you are a freshman. The atmosphere in the libraries are great and really helps me focus. Having a friend or two around to keep you accountable doesn't hurt either.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: As a first semester college freshman, I am still taking my general education classes and have yet to start the classes that relate mainly to my major. However, I do recommend starting slow the first two semesters, taking the minimum necessary, as you are still getting used to life on campus and the work load. The professors and GSIs I have had so far are great, and although not every professor and GSI have the same teaching style, I have not encountered a professor or GSI whom I do not like.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have never been challenged as much as when I cam to Berkeley. The things you learn in one class often overlap with what you learn in another, and the faculty are usually engaged and willing to answer questions and talk to students.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Berkeley is nationally ranked in almost every academic discipline. If you want great academics at a fraction of the cost of an Ivy, then look no further.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Workload is tough, but there are always ways to get help. The program is fantastic- 3rd best in the nation. The professors are all very accomplished, although that doesn't necessarily mean they are great at teaching. The undergraduate adviser in the college of chemistry is on top of helping students and providing opportunities for jobs and interesting internships.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There is a lot of competition in classes, but there are always someone to be friends with. Registration sucks, not going to lie. Many times the classes or discussions you had planned to register for have already been taken before it's your turn to register , but there are always multiple options to pick from.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm a sociology major, and the classes I've taken are captivating and inspiring. The professors care about you and want you to feel the same passion you feel. There are many organizations on campus that help sociology majors form connections with professors and other undergrads.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The workload is hard, but the support is great. Discussion sections are priceless for understanding lecture materials and the Student Learning Center provides free tutors for various subjects. When you get a good grade on a subject, all your hard work is definitely worth it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My major is capped so there is an application process, although it is extremely easy. You just need to have at least a 3.0 GPA.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Registration is terrible. But the classes can be amazing and there is such diversity.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Amazing researchers and professors. The work is hard, but it's Berkeley, does anyone expect anything less?
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The counselors want that their students perform the best that they can.  Even though their schedules are very strict, they always find time for students.  Do not hesitate to ask questions! That is why counselors exist!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Classes are tough, everything is curved
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Nobel Laureates, plenty of research and competition
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The teachers sometimes expect you to know more basic topics and consequently don't go over them. However, the classes are organized, thorough, and informative.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Especially for some classes, they really give you your share of homework. Additionally, there are plenty of other smart students so most aren't able to just breeze through their classes for the harder majors.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: UCB taught me to love political science to a degree I didn't think possible. AWESOME professors and guest lecturers. I wish I had more than four years here.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: So many great academic options it's dizzying. I honestly wish I could major in everything. Professors are accessible, but won't come to you--you have to take the initiative to speak to them first. From there on usually they're enthusiastic about helping you out.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors I have had are some of the smartest people I have ever had the honor of being taught in their presence.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: UC Berkeley is the top public school in the nation and for a reason; its very difficult.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The classes you take as a lower classmen will be difficult, as you will be in a room of 500 people competing against each other.  As a Public Health Major, students are definitely more chill than your typical pre-med major.  The workload is extremely manageable, and there are tons of opportunities for internships and jobs.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Be prepared to get screwed by telebears at least once in your college career.  The professors range from more interested in their research to extremely invested in the students.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Incredible academic experience.  Great classes, great professors.  Oh, and way more Nobel Prizes than Stanford.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Being a philosophy major is great.  It doesn't require too many courses so you can pursue another major or minor if you so choose.  The professors are phenomenal.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great professors who actually CARE about you and your success!
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: I had to work HARD but the curriculum and faculty are amazing! So many opportunities for jobs and internships, and professors and GSIs are always trying to help you out and find you positions. Being an IB major, I got to take human biology courses and environmental/plant courses. I loved the integration of the two sides of biology.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Some majors are capped but we're encouraged to reach our preffered goals.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Fabulous opportunities.
I'm at the #1 History Department in the world.
Lots of opportunities to interact with T.A.'s although often the professors are a bit remote/arrogant. I would have to admit to that.
I belong to the Honors History Society and the History Club.  People are somewhat friendly but very competitive. By this I mean, that people NEVER want to share their notes (if you miss a class for example). That's disappointing.  I always share my notes if someone is in need.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review:
No complaints.
Brilliant professors, fairly accessible although for a very limited amount of office time. For example, you get perhaps l0 minutes to meet with them before they say "I've got other students waiting."

The campus has over 35, 000 students so it is a bit impersonal here admittedly.
My only complaint is that I would rather have been on a very small campus but with the incredible academic opportunities here.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The vast amount of courses across innumerable fields allows for everyone to find their place. Every discipline is staffed by world renowned professors and the best Graduate Student Instructors in that field. The school allows for the creation of your own interdisciplinary major, should that be what you are looking for, but also offers countless majors that focus and expand your knowledge in that sub-field at the same time.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I cannot imagine a better academic environment than Berkeley. You are challenged in every field but at the same time you are offered countless opportunities to receive support and academic guidance. In a school this large, the curriculum can feel overwhelming but Cal does an incredible job of teaching you to fight for what you deserve and exemplifies the "you get what you work for" motto.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you go to office hours the professors are magnificent. Very important to attend.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Semi good tutors and gsi's willing to lend a hand.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Opportunities are everywhere its just up to you to take them.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Faculty don't care about the undergraduates.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: competitive.  lots of workload.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Most majors and the degree that come with it will greatly help you find a job after graduation. However, finishing the major with good GPA will be extremely difficult and some major advisers have a little below average quality.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The workload is significant, but if you can get through Berkeley, you can get through anything. If you major in something you love, the workload doesn't feel like a burden because it's so interesting. There are so many interesting classes here, there's plenty to keep any student engaged.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Professors are experts in their field.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Tons of internship and research opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The profs here are hired for their research, so some are really bad at lecturing. GSIs are helpful as is reading the book.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: EECS at Berkeley is the greatest major ever. It is really tough to get into and only gets more difficult once you get here (unlike Stanford). But everyone I know comes out of it with a job and are often making 6 digits. Also, EECS is very well funded, unlike some other majors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I had to take an audition but the professors were very gracious.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The majors are excellent. It is easy for everyone to find something appropriate.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Here at Berkeley, professors don't teach you how to think critically and creatively, instead, you're taught to think formulaically and solve problems in one set way. Most classes have at least 100 people. Office hours are impossible since professors are primarily concerned with their graduate students. It is not uncommon for professors to never grade, let alone see your papers since GSIs (graduate student instructors) grade everything.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academics at Berkeley have a reputation that precedes itself. The grad students whom teach the smaller "sections" within the lectures are very helpful towards undergrad students. They are knowledgeable and approachable as well. However, a lot of the classes are theory based, as opposed to hands-on.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: The academics at Cal are a thing of legend. As a student, I can attest that the legend is indeed true. Professors at Cal are often thoughtful and compassionate. You will encounter the occasional professor that is distant but that is a rarity. The registration process is simple enough, after a short tutorial and a little critical thinking. The workload can often be extreme, but not entirely unmanageable. There are an abundance of places to study that are beautiful as well as functional. You can't do better than Cal.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: UC Berkeley is a university based on scholarship with extensive libraries and resources available. This is the place for students and academics that are more self-motivated than prone to guided education. In essence, you get out based on the amount of time and effort you put in.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Number one public university of the country. Can't complain and can't be more proud that I went to this school. Though very tough sometimes but the challenge is worthwhile. Wish I did even more in college though. There were so many opportunities available to us!
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: UC Berkeley is the BEST public university and you are in class with some of the smartest students in the world and you have professor that are experts in their field. However, even though the professors know everything about the subject they are teaching, many are not good at explaining and teaching the subjects to the students. There is a wide variety of majors to choose from and very diverse school population with a variety of activities that will fit your taste.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Being in Computer Science, is fairly good considering Berkeley has a really great department. It can be difficult though since there is a lot of competition not only in the classes, but also to get into them. The number of people in the classes can sometimes get overwhelming, but you learn to get used to that (as that persists for all lower division classes and a fair number of upper division classes).
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I love the academics of this school. We have a lot of resources, and many opportunities to grow and learn as students. I feel like the campus is very encouraging in that department. The one thing that I could see a huge improvement on is the registration for classes part, since it is very tedious.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Knowledgeable people, tons of opportunities. As a science major, curves can be rough, but there are a lot of study resources that can help. The SLC (Student Learning Center) is very helpful if you feel like you're drowning.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Knowledgeable people, tons of opportunities. Easy to get lost though, you have to be independent and assertive.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There are some professors are campus that are truly inspiring! There are also classes that are life-changing and will definitely challenge what you believe in!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As a science major at Cal, resources are abundant, especially if you're looking for research opportunities. However, the grade curves and some of the not-so-helpful GSIs somewhat makes these classes less enjoyable.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I enjoy my program because it is small and so it's much easier to obtain advice from our advisor. Our general education courses are easy to complete so we can have an earlier start on taking courses that interest us.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Internships here in UC Berkeley, or in general, the Bay Area, is really hard to get. They generally accept students who are currently taking upper division courses or have obtain an undergraduate degree. You can find better opportunities in Hawaii if you didn't meet those said traits.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am very happy with my major of microbiology. Because it is a small program, we can see our advisor much more easily and he can give higher quality advice. What I wish is that my major didn't need certain classes and could replace those with other more interesting classes.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The architecture program is great. The studios are extremely demanding though, but all other courses are manageable. The staff are excellent and friendly, with some exceptions in the studios. The studio professors are extremely driven and are not there to be your friend or role model. The other professors are fun and very involved in their student's education. There are plenty of internship opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: When applying to the school, I didn't do anything special on my application, but I think it might have helped that I applied as a Philosophy major, as opposed to something capped or more popular like Psychology or Econ. Declaring majors are relatively easy, once you have met the requirements (each major has different minimum standards) then you can fill out a major declaration form. As a Philosophy/Peace and Conflict Studies double major, it's pretty easy for me to get the classes that I need before I declare. On a side note, I love that Berkeley has awesome majors like Peace and Conflict Studies. I would definitely recommend taking a look at all the different options or talking to a counselor before you choose your major.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Professors are top notch if they are lecturers... not so great if theyre doing experiments
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very challenging everyone is premed and competitive
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: To get into the Economics major, you have to meet a certain GPA requirement which isn't too hard to make. After that it's just paperwork.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review:
I am an Integrative Biology and a Spanish Language and Literatures minor.  My major and my minor are no walk in the park.  I love the rigor, but the rigor also drives me insane.  The workload is doable and understandable if you manage your time efficiently.  
My major is a composition of all the sciences: Chemistry, Biology, and Physics.  Mathematics is also a requirement.  None of them are easy, so be prepared, especially for Chemistry.
Language classes are intense as well.  Whether you are a native speaker or not, be prepared for the rigor.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics are excellent! However, there is one guideline that everyone must follow: you either sink, or swim.  It is also a good idea to create study groups in order to master the material.  The classes are insanely brutal, so be prepared.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: To get into the Economics major at Berkeley, you need to complete a list of prerequisites. The most important criteria for admission would probably be your GPA. Because the major is so popular, admission is limited to those who can uphold a 3.0 GPA in the prerequisites.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I enjoy being an Economics major because the major allows for flexibility. You can either approach the more social side of Economics or the more math related side of Economics. The work load is definitely not light. The only drawback to being in this program is that it is a very popular program and therefore, it is difficult to get to know professors and academic advisers.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As a Chemical Engineering major, I know I made the right decision to come to Berkeley. I absolutely love the College of Chemistry. It's honestly the best of both worlds; you can attend the large public school but have a smaller community of students that you see practically every day and interact with over four years. There are so many professors doing so many types of research. With some perseverance and genuine interest, you can work on their graduate students' project from freshman year onward. The national ChemE club, the American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE) has several resources for ChemE majors. Although I'm still deciding on where I want to take my career (you soon realize that the opportunities with a ChemE degree are practically endless), I know I won't have any problem finding a job within 6 months after I graduate.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There is an incredible amount of opportunities at Berkeley. I haven't had one yet but I plan to next summer and am sure I will find a good one. It helps that it is the perfect location. With San Fran right around the corner and other places its opens up so many options.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm doing a double major of Biology and Marine Science, so my schedule for all four years is pretty stacked. But its not impossible. I have had trouble figuring out what classes are going to be available when I'm an upper class men, so I can plan. And even advisors for your specific majors can't really help you with this problem either. So you sometimes have to go on fate that you will even be able to complete all your requirements. No strange admission processes, just the normal UCB app. Just be willing to spend time with advisors and planning so that you can finish in four years with not to heavy of a load each semester. And make sure its something you love.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Berkeley has the top program for almost all its majors and that helps get a diverse array of people around the school. The majors are hard though, studying is a huge priority at Berkeley because of the intense workload that is required just to pass ones classes. But in the end its worth it because you will be ahead of people in your same field that went to other schools and have a better chance of finding a good job after college ends.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: At UC Berkeley, there are SO many options for the students. The majors are all applicable to any type of job you wish to pursue. It is really easy to take pre reqs for more than one major so that you have options by the time you have to declare. The curriculum is competitive, but that should be expected from the #1 public university worldwide.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I haven't had, not have I looked for an internship as of yet.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I really enjoy the English program. I get to study what I love!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm happy in the English Department here. Yes, as an English major, there's a constant nagging doubt that my degree will be worthless (it doesn't help that I've got a bunch of Bio/Chem major friends), but I'd like to go into teaching, so It shouldn't be too hard to find a job.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Getting into the English program is pretty easy- just make sure to take all your prerequisites and you'll be fine. Going to office hours really helps.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Some colleges are amazing/useful, such as Engineering & Haas Business. Others are inept, thus making things harder for the overall student majority. Coursework is intense, and requires lots of time management. Seeing professors & TAs are a must to survive.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review:
As stated before, I'm an English major. I've never had an internship but I have held quite a few on-campus jobs. The reason why I've never had an internship is because they are usually unpaid - I've paid for my schooling and my cost of living on my own (with help from financial aid) so spending time on an intership that doesn't pay was out of the question.

Financial aid (thankfully) gave me a workstudy award, which pretty much means you are placed in an exclusive club that employers pick from. If you have workstudy, it means that the government has agreed to pay half of your salary...thus endearing you to the hearts of most on-campus employers as a very cheap, high quality employee. So far, I've had a lot of luck with workstudy. I've had 4 really good jobs that gave me good experience, good pay, and good networking opportunities. In fact, my current job is so great that my current boss has decided to help me find a paid internship. Yes, folks, my boss is so kind that she has decided to find me a rare gem - a paid internship. 

Moral of the story? If you can't get an intership due to lack of experience, lack of luck, lack of time, or because you need to pay the bills try and get an on-campus job!
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Political Science is a nationally top-ranked major at Berkeley, and will prepare you for virtually any related occupation.  These include government, international affairs, and academics.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The major is fairly competitive to get in to because there are many applicants.It is suggested to apply as early as you can. The most important criteria is so have all of the prerequisites completed or in progress of completion with all passing grades.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: There is a lack of racial diversity within the content of the major.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: There are a lot of majors to choose from, unfortunately Education or something like it is not one of them. Most research is rooted in the Natural Sciences, but we take our Social Sciences very seriously here.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I'm well prepared for whatever I want to do. The support is excellent, and professors are easy to talk to. You just have to know what you want to do to get the most out of it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As far as admission goes, it was relatively easy to get into my program. However, I changed majors a bunch of times and completed too many sets of prereqs. My advice: know what you want to do before you start anything.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It's good for getting into grad school, but my major was not very well-suited for training me professionally.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Super competitive because of all the premed students in the major.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: The professors and lecturers are all truly world-class in their knowledge, if not in their teaching ability (though I would say most are both).
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: UC Berkeley has so many resources available and the staff is amazing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: UC Berkeley has challenged me to my maximum potential.  I never thought I could achieve what I have this past year.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My advisor is super helpful, and my professors are great!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: So far I'm taking premedical program preparation courses and I'm very happy with the online program's flexibility as I'm doing it in parallel with life/work/everything else.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I applied and got in. I found it very straightforward
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I think the Math program is pretty strong. The courses are very rigorous, even online, and I ended up finding a tutor to help me weather the class. This was a critical step for me as the online courses have very little interaction with other students and teachers.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I love my program it is smaller so you get individualized attention and you get to do so much more hands on work.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Sometimes it can be difficult and you need to learn on your own
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am majoring in Landscape Architecture at the College of Environmental Design, and I couldn't be happier with my college and major.  CED is amazing; there are so many creative people here and all of the advisors and professors are so amazingly helpful.  The professors I have had here are my favorites, by far, and I have made the best friends here.  People are known to live in the studios here (as Architecture and Landscape Architecture majors are usually known to do), but everyone at CED is very passionate about what they are studying and everyone is hungry to learn about and improve in design.  CED really stresses a connection of all three of the fields of Architecture, Landscape Architecture, and Urban Studies, allowing for students to study all three and learn fundamentals of each to design at their best.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors rarely care about undergraduates' passion for their research. Some professors do not even accept undergraduates who are looking to do honors thesis in their lab. This school also have a policy that blocks their own undergraduates from getting into their graduate program.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Some majors are capped, which means they have extra requirements or limitations which I did not know of before applying so I guess that's partially my fault. The Business program has a veryy selective application process.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Not sure yet but I'm looking at their PREMED/POSTBAC program and thinking about this. Seems like there are good options.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I've been mostly impressed by my professors so far. There are some duds but that's always the case.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The science department is the strongest in Berkeley.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Not every major is good, the science departments are top notch but if you want to go into arts or anything like that steer clear.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors are very helpful and they are all very smart scholars. Engineering and Statistics are the most popular and money-making majors.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

I think its important to explain how you are different than other applicants versus trying to fit into the criteria of specific GMAT scores, experiences, and recommendations. Show who you truely are and why Hass, which has a great program creating innovative leaders, is right for you.

Campus.Review:
Berkeley is great! There are so many affordable food options, with cuisine from all over the world. There's a downtown farmers market every Saturday and markets on historic Telegraph Ave. during the summer. Campus is great, with its historic campanile, beautiful old buildings, museums, libraries, tree groves, and there's a vibrant atmosphere. Students care about academics and social issues. Football games at memorial stadium are fun. There are great places to catch a magical view of sunset over the Bay and San Francisco. 

Transportation by buses is pretty good - you can get a lot of places with the AC transport bus pass that comes with your UC Berkeley ID card, including SF and nearby Tilden Regional Park (which has hiking, a lake, a little farm, etc). And BART is pretty good for getting to the City. 

Downtown Shattuck has improved over the years. It's not the cleanest, and there are lots of homeless individuals but they do not generally cause any problems. It has it's charm though, and the movie theaters are nice, the trees are wrapped in lights. Some people say that it is dangerous, but it's really generally very safe as long as you take reasonable care like not walking by yourself late at night through the more south & west side areas. There are also really great family neighborhoods of Berkeley, with classic great big Berkeley houses.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Berkeley, although it has its views of the Bay, is quite a dangerous area and I don't feel safe here at all. However, San Francisco is nearby and there are some better parts of town the farther away from Berkeley.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: lots of hobos, smelly in some places but really nice in others. I'd say Berkeley has a good mix of vibes.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There is so much culture at Berkeley. Everyone is super accepting. The town has a lot of restaurants and bars, which a lot of students take advantage of. It's a great campus town.

Campus.Review: Berkeley itself is an amazing place, San Francisco is just an added bonus.

Campus.Review: its pretty safe and clean
Campus.Author: College Junior

If you don't understand how to do an assignment in a math class, feel free to go into the Student Learning Center where you will receive free tutoring. If you just want to study in a quiet area, well there are over 40 libraries to choose from. Student life on campus is what Berkeley is about.

Campus.Review:
1. I personally like using computer labs or pen+paper. I may be in a smaller subset of students on campus, though, since 80% of people I see bring their own laptops nowadays. Isn't that stuff heavy? Where are all the outlets? How do you not procrastinate online during class?

2. No free printing, but it's not expensive. Having your own printer is probably more reliable.

3. I don't know anyone who doesn't own a personal computer though. That would be pretty difficult. Slides are usually posted online, you'll need constant email access, etc.

4. Airbears, the campus wireless access, has decent coverage.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review:
Berkeley is a very dynamic city! It's a community that has its own character, and people are really friendly - they'll have conversations with you at a coffee shop and you'll end up talking about the local theater scene. There are ton of good restaurants (Chez Panisse is one of the few Michelin starred restaurants in the Bay Area), activities that you can walk to, and if you're ever bored of Berkeley itself, you can BART to San Francisco and spend the day in the big city. 

Cal games get a lot of alumni and school spirit, especially since we reopened our stadium. There *is* a large homeless population here and that might be something visitors notice first, but it is rarely ever a safety issue and there are a lot of organizations to volunteer at if you want to help out.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review:
Pros:

1. Berkeley is SUPER WALKABLE. Many places - groceries, restaurants, campus - are within 10-20 minutes of walking distance if you live somewhat close to campus. You will do a lot of walking because cars are actually pretty difficult to keep here, since parking is expensive and there isn't much of it. But exercise is good.

2. We all get a Class Pass in the beginning of the semester ($71 in our tuition) that allows for unlimited AC Transit rides (bus system) anytime in that semester. This means the bus can reach BART, campus, Amtrak, and anywhere in between.

3. 51B will be your best friend if you live on the South Side, which many students do. It runs every 10 minutes and gets you to class when you're running late.

4. Free UC Berkeley shuttles that runs in loops around campus and nearby neighborhoods. You can track where they are online, so you don't have to wait long.

Cons:

1. Actually none. Outside of having less car-accessibility, Berkeley has great transit options. You can walk, bike, bus, shuttle, drive (it's not impossible), longboard, whatever and get to where you need to be.

Campus.Review: It's usually chilly out. I love it!
