Campus.Review: There are several computer labs on campus .. I have experience in going to the computer labs which are offered on all dorms (unit 1,2,3, and Foothill) These computers are only available to students who are living in the dorms though, but they are still very convenient. the print rates are 10cents per black and white page and 15cents per color page. the computer labs are usually open from 7 to midnight! Network is super fast. I haven't had any trouble with it. Also the software availability for MAC or PC are usually free. I got my word processing, excel, and power point programs for free for just being a Cal student. Also if you're into photography like myself, they also offer Adobe Photoshop for FREE!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There is public transportation everywhere! I usually take the AC Transit which is free for all Cal students. The AC Transit runs through all of the Bay Area. It takes you literally anywhere, there are different bus schedules, so you can go to SF, Airport, Oakland, Richmond,. anywhere! There is also great taxi service, but I personally use Uber app to get around. (Check it out!) The BART is also a few minutes away from campus, (10-15 if walking) (5 on bus) .. The BART is much faster than AC Transit and passenger rates are convenient.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I'm from SoCal and this weather sucks in compairison to SoCal!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Depends on where you dorm, Clark Kerr is awesome for having unused computers.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Not awesome but will get you from point a to point b
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The parking at any of the UC campuses is pretty bad. You're better off walking or biking.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The day usually starts and ends pretty chilly, but can get pretty hot in the middle of the day in the spring and fall. Wearing layers is key.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: One of the best places to be in the Bay area! So vibrant and fun!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Berkeley does not disappoint when it comes to electronics.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I LOVE THE WEATHER HERE! It is never too hot or too cold, there is always a light breeze and I could not ask for better weather in the lovely state of California.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There is always so much going on in Berkeley. Through the school and the city alike. No matter what you are interested in or what your social life is like, there is something for you at Berkeley. If you are largely into the party scene and enjoy going out on the weekends, you have the option to go to frat parties and house parties. If you prefer to spend your time doing other activities that are not centered around alcohol or partying, there are plenty of concerts, performances, Latin dance nights, etc. to get involved in.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The amazing diversity of the campus is unmatched at any other university. Not just in the student body, but the professors come from some of the most diverse and amazing backgrounds. Because Berkeley is a large research university, there are opportunities unlike anywhere else for research or internships or jobs in any field you may be interested in. Another great thing about a large public university like Berkeley is that nothing is handed to you. All opportunities have to be sought out and fought for on your own. You learn how to tackle the real world.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I love Berkeley life. There's so much to do, from discovering hiking trails, to encountering new restaurants, to window shopping in boutiques.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: We have Bart, which is cheap and relatively fast, and we also have AC transit, which is slow but free with your ID card.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Its almost impossible to find a parking space around town, and if you do it most likely has a meter. Hardly any students keep cars on campus, its more convenient to take the bus thats free with your ID card.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are many places to go if you're looking for something to do that's fun.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Buses are good if you want to go places around the city and Bart is good to go to San Francisco. Long distance travel can be a hassle though.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Super expensive and can only park on campus during school hours if you live more than 2 miles away.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The role of Greek society is a bit to dominating for my taste.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Amazing international reputation. Incredible researchers.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Overall, gorgeous weather. But, when it does rain, campus can flood.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Costly, but most people don't have cars.
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: Campus life is so vivacious! There is ALWAYS tabling happening on Sproul Hall.  Student involvement is VERY high.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Transportation is pretty good.  The buses are the best option for students.  Cars, in my opinion, are the worst to have in Berkeley.  Finding a parking space is hell, and parking fees are an arm and a leg.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Alumni network and recruiting is great
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I love walking through campus
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I don't have a car. Based on friend's opinions
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: If you look for them, there are a tremendous amount of resources available.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Although some buildings look old and bland, some are quite nice. The gym is right next to campus, and it has anything you'd really need for exercise. And it's cheap!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There's wifi all around campus that you can access by logging in to your Berkeley account. There are computer labs in every dorm as well.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It's generally pretty hard to find a free parking spot near your destination.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: If you're bored, you can find stuff to do if you walk around. But near West side of campus it's mostly just places to eat.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There are a few rainy days, but for the most part it's usually sunny.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Warm all the way through Halloween (no weather worries regarding skimpier outfits) and sometimes even Thanksgiving.  You don't really get seasons--that's a con to some and a pro to others I guess.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Dorm wifi is BEAUTIFUL. Campus wifi is almost always great, but in certain lecture halls/buildings/rooms it's pretty stubborn. Tech support in the dorms comes literally to the door of your room, which is great. Computer labs are pretty much everywhere, and the computers are fast, reliable, and oh-so-pretty.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review:
I didn't want to come to Berkeley originally since I had heard it was dirty and hobo-filled. Wrong--campus itself is gorgeous, nearly all the dirt is concentrated on South Side, West Side is full of fantastic restaurants and movie theaters, and North Side is peaceful and pretty. When I first arrived I resolved to try every restaurant once. It's my second year and I've barely made a dent since I can't stop myself going back to the same awesome Thai places, food trucks, and cafes.

There's a ridiculous amount of character and soul through the whole town, and it's quickly become my favorite place in the world.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review:
Students get free transport on AC Transit (plus the campus-run shuttles), and both run the perimeter of campus--so unless your classes are all smack in the middle of campus (unlikely), there's a quick way to get pretty much anywhere. (Even if you're in the middle of campus, two campus-run lines run into/through the center.) It's not much of a concern anyway, since campus is pretty compact. Buses aren't always perfectly on time, but that's okay because around campus there's SO DARN MANY BUSES.

AC Transit runs throughout the Bay Area and even into San Francisco, and crosses most heavily-student-inhabited areas in and around campus. It's easy and fast to get nearly anywhere totally free.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Berkeley is a great city and near San Francisco, there is always something fun to do.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I use my own laptop however I can pay to print paper or use a friends printer.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Weather by the bay gets really cold at night but it's always warm or a little chilly during the day.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Buses are available every couple feet and every minute. However, locals do make the public transportation difficult and overcrowded.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Student life on campus is thriving, you'll never not run into somebody, people are everywhere.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The school offers among the bed education possible for a public school but is very costly and unfortunately is an unsafe environment.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I use public transportation all the time.  Students get bus passes which will take them as far as San Francisco or Oakland.  There is also the BART, which is really cheap and can take people almost everywhere in the bay area.  I've gone as far as Santa Clara using public transportation (BART and CalTrain).
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Berkeley is not your typical college town.  Although there are lots of students, there are also a lot of people who are not students.  There is a vibrant culture in Berkeley, although it does get really sketch late at night.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: For California weather, Berkeley weather gets extremely cold at times.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are a variety of opportunities, but you have to find them yourself/take the initiative.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Student life is extremely active.  Unlike other UC's you can be whoever you want, from the ones who don't like going out much, to the partiers, or the type of people who invest everything in clubs.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It is Bay Area, but it isn't San Francisco.  Generally cool but without fog or rain.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It is a city.  There is good food available, but the housing costs more.  Surrounding area is so college-dominated that there really can't possibly be any conflict between residents and students.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I have wifi everywhere I go.  The school does everything possible to make computer labs available, but having your own laptop would of course still be far more convenient.  You get the latest Microsoft Office for free, along with a bunch of Adobe programs like Photoshop.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Honestly, you probably don't need a car in Berkeley.  If you do need one, you might have a bit of a hard time.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Going to San Francisco on the BART cost about eight dollars, round trip.  Berkeley students can ride the bus for free and there are shuttles available as well.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Great academic programs and campus life! The buildings are beautiful and historical, and the campus has such a great vibe to it!
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Great people, great places. The athletic center is beautiful, with tons of equipment and machines to use, as well as numerous pools. The libraries do get crowded, but they are spacious and have thousands of books!
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: There are a few bars, but that is about it. Sometimes there are art shows or art murmurs in Oakland, but not too much else. A little bit of shopping, but most stores are in the city.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: You definitely need your own laptop for school work if you don't want to spend all your time on campus. I never brought a laptop to class but most do. If you decide not to, though, there are plenty of libraries with computers and printers around. I never had a problem!
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: I don't know much about it because there is so little of it!
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Bay Area weather is crazy, but its bearable. Now snow and some rain, and plenty of sun its great.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review:
Bay Area weather is fabulous.
Having moved here from Merced and l00 degree weather six months a year, I cannot complain~
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review:
Lots of stuff to do.. tons of cultural activities to go to.
I usually go to see a theatre production twice a week.  I go to parks every weekend.
I go to the San Francisco Bay almost every week to and walk our dog.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review:
Tons of classes to choose from, superlative professors.  Lots of clubs to join.
Therapy dog day on 4 times a month.
Beautiful setting, buildings, campus.
Lots of trees, squirrels everywhere~
Love the campanile and how the bells chime every day at noon.
World-renowned reputation, best public university in the world.
What more could I possibly say?
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review:
Lots of clubs to join -- I belong to the History Club and also to the Honors History Society.
Also belong to the Drama Club.
 I go to a lot of theatre events on campus and occasionally to music events as well.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review:
I take the bus to and from school
Buses run about every 20 minutes ... however, often there is a 30 minute wait for them.
Transportation is available but time-consuming.
Often the buses are really crowded and I don't get a seat.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It can get really windy, and cold!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I do not have a car, so I cannot say. However, I have heard a number of my peers complain.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Berkeley is very scenic and easily accesible via AC transit. And whatever your needs, if they cant be met at Berkeley, then a quick BART trip to any of the Bay area cities is easy and cheap. Oakland, San Francisco, Richmond, and San Jose are all within reach. Lots of food options too!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Personally, I don't own a car, but I know that parking is pretty much unavailable, and the ones that you can find are usually a 15-minute walk from campus, and also expensive.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Most of the year at Berkeley is sunny, warm, and beautiful. There are incredible views of the Golden Gate and it's generally pleasant. Like any weather, it gets cold and rains but even with the most bitter temperatures (and us Californians mean about 40 degrees), the sky is clear and the sun is out.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Always cold, never have I seen a good warm day.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Disgusting streets and there are always bums in the neighborhood.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Cold in the winter, but dorms are warm.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: It gets a little scary at night sometimes.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Not too cold, not too hot.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: I loved Berkeley.  It rocks
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: I never used the campus computer but the campus wireless is decent. Some buildings, especially the crowded ones, will have slower internet connection because of the vast number of students using the internet for class.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The weather is very bipolar. Morning and night could be freezing and the day could get really hot and humid, even though the thermostat reads around 77 degree fahrenheit. I would still like southern california weather more.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The city of Berkeley has its ups and downs. Lower portion of the hill can be scary and unsafe whereas upper portions of the hill is the opposite. There seems to have a lot of student events going on off-campus.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: There are definitely many beautiful, historically significant spots on campus (Memorial Glade, Sproul Plaza, Sather Gate, Doe Library) and I am awed at the beauty of my campus every day. There is also a lot of nature throughout the campus -- lots of trees, a creek, and beautiful grassy fields.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: If you go to Cal, you are guaranteed a job.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a degree from Berkeley is quite high. Berkeley is a highly prestigious institution and is known for its achievements as a research campus. Just attending Berkeley will offer you a huge network of opportunities, as long as you work for it.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Because I am part of CNR, SPUR is an option for internships; otherwise there are many resources available to help you find jobs and internships.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Many job fairs occur and industries are constantly looking to our school for potential employees.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Just having Berkeley on your resume goes a long way. The career center is extremely helpful in helping you edit your resume, practice for interviews, and search for jobs.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Whenever I tell someone I'm going to Berkeley, they seem impressed. I see a lot of influential people who have attained degrees from this institution.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Computer Science has a pretty solid network here
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I have high hopes of getting a job after graduation.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Again, I think this is unmatched anywhere else. The alumni community is such a strong knit group, that is head over heels about the current students. There are professional fraternities, in which alumni of specific majors get to connect to current students of that major. The career center is amazing about helping you find jobs and internships, as well as helping you land them.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: Berkeley has an amazing career center with advisors who can help you meet employers.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Felt like I had space to fully put myself on paper
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Easy to get internships. People treat Stanford and Berkeley no differently. Both are extremely good here.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I am confident in my ability to receive employment out of college.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: People have a big support network for internships and other connections. It looks very good on a resume to go to this school.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Watching a lot of my friends graduate this year and walk into great jobs was very encouraging.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Berkeley's reputation will hopefully be the saving grace for many of us, it's name getting us through many interviews.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The degree form this school is invaluable! For most majors finding a job really quick after graduation with such a degree is guaranteed. Employers on campus work very effectively. The jobs fairs are organized, interesting, and clear.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: This is a top-notch school that looks great on any resume. That alone definitely gives you an upper hand in a job search. However, career fairs and job listings are abundant, online and on campus.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: There is an active culture for career seeking, networking, and other supportive programs such as multiple career fairs, job/internship portals, and constant stream of recruiters offering workshops and information session on their companies.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: People respect a Berkeley education, and that is something I value. As a student in a field that isn't quite thriving, I appreciate that the education I get now will be recognized by others for its rigor and comprehensiveness.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel that a Berkeley education will definitely be recognized nationwide!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There's a lot of career fairs and things one can do to put ourselves out there.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a degree from this institution is unparalleled
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: If you get a degree from Berkeley, you'll get a job.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I've heard that big corporations or depending on the networks/connections you make in Berkeley really helps you get a career once you get your degree in Berkeley.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are several opportunities, but you really have to work hard to get them.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are many internship opportunities and options, although the process of being accepted into such a position is often extraordinarily competitive. Sometimes those in Greek life are given an advantage over those that are not involved if a past alumni of the fraternity or sorority is involved with the organization.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: After you survive the rigor of getting a degree at this school, it's very easy to make connections through the alum network and general networking in the Bay area. Lots of name recognition.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I am told that having a degree from Berkeley is a really great resume builder
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I hope to do an honors thesis and make great connections.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I think a degree from this school can bring many opportunities.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: A lot of networking options.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Cal is competitive and crowded. Many doors will open from attending here, but there are thousands of us in the bay so you have to work above and beyond. The career center is helpful and a huge resource that should be used.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Cal already has such a prestigious branding that recruiters come looking for students here. There is definitely a surplus of opportunities, it is just what you make of your resources.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There is something to be said for your brand name, but I don't truly believe alums from Berkeley really help out current students as much as private school alums do.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: People are always looking for Berkeley studnets and they have higher amount of opportunities upon graduating.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of a degree from Berkeley is high, but not as high as from an IV like Harvard or Stanford due to the GPAs that also leave Berkeley. Berkeley GPA's are generally lower than IV league schools for whatever reason and that effects job prospects. But overall, it is generally understood that Berkeley degrees are highly revered.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are internships on campus where I can apply for benefits and good pay. I found a job with a substantial income.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Because this is a prestigious and recognizable school, I think it is easier to find jobs in certain fields than those who graduated from schools that are less recognized.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Berkeley's prestige really speaks for itself. For that reason, most companies seem to respect the value of a Berkeley degree. Berkeley's career fairs always seem to attract most of the top companies from Silicon Valley and the Career Center offers plenty of resources to help you find a career that matches your interests.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: im still a freshmen but i believe theyre pretty good
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: If you are a CS major you are set for Silicon Valley, IF you work hard.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Berkeley has an incredible reputation. It is the number one public school in the nation--that is pretty much the only reason I decided to come here. We have career fairs pretty much every week and the staff at the career center is vey helpful with finding jobs and internships. A degree from Berkeley will immediately put you above other applicants when searching for a job (given that your experience in the field is comparable to the rest of the pool).
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Cal is a well-known school with a lot of alumni connections to help with job prospects.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Pre-med life is hard because of competition and GPA requirement. A lot of internships available and large alumni base but because of how many students there are it' hard to find research and job positions.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The value of the degree is big because this school is really prestigious.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The Berkeley reputation carries a lot of weight, especially in the engineering and social science fields.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I've taken advantage of work study while here at Berkeley and I feel like it has already opened up a large door into doing something that I want to do. Access to information about jobs (while attending, and post-graduation) is easy to get to and understand and there are helpful services to assist with resume building and looking for employment. I am confident that I will have all the tools I need for employment after I graduate.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Having Berkeley on your resume is definitely really good for you, there's a lot of name recognition there.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: Cal alumni are above average in taking care of their underclassmen.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The opportunities offered by the university are incredible and cover a wide range of disciplines. This statement is based on my experience with the area and what I have heard about it. I, however, do not have much experience with it becauseI am a freshman and have not explored the area in much depth.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Cal will not guarantee you a job but it sure will prepare you
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: It's a great school and everyone knows it so I would say your chances are great when it comes to finding internships and jobs, just make sure your have something to show for your time here other than a stellar GPA.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Career fairs and opportunities are everywhere so there is no reason to be discouraged.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: You can go anywhere with a degree from UCB. Its a school that well known worldwide, we have strong affiliations with most west coast companies like google, Facebook, etc.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: If you go here, your employers will know how hard it was.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: To get financial aid you must pester the office repeatedly and wait in long lines.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: If you put in the effort, you can find scholarships but there are restrictions on some and there aren't a whole lot of them available at the same time.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: After receiving the financial package, be very careful about submitting a financial appeal. Often times, they can take away some of your aid if they find something missing or just change their mind. This happened to me and now I am trying to find other ways to afford college.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: It was a process that worked well
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: I have applied for numerous scholarships and have received a Pell Grant, Cal Grant, and several other scholarships. Understanding the issues of financial aid for classes has been a hassle, but I have received good assistance.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: Financial aid process is hectic. Many of us don't get funded till much after. You are required to use money from your pocket most times.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: This school is very expensive. I have financial aid but I am not too familiar with how it works because I am the first in my family to go to college so I often struggle with financial aid.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Berkeley wants you to succeed but you need to earn it every step of the way
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Fiefs gave me my money and that was it
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I do not want Parent Plus loans. Stop trying to give me it.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Great for getting a job. Employers definitely interested in Berkeley students
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Never overpay for anything if you are waiting for fianncial aid to come in! They will take forever to reimburse you!
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: I qualify for a grant but never received anything
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I never really had to deal with it so I don't know much about the process.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: It's Cal, they expect you to know the basics when it comes to attending classes, signing paperwork etc. If you want handholding, this place isn't for you. That said, a great school.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Applying wasn't difficult at all, but my family didn't receive aid until this past year. Paying for school has been tough on all of us as my siblings went to graduate school and medical school after getting their bachelor's degrees.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Financial aid is the only reason I can afford to go to Berkeley and I am forever grateful for it.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: No offers since the school has no money.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: its kinda confusing trying to keep track of everything
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I did not have a huge problem getting financial aid. I got a pretty good amount and am comfortable in terms of finances.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: This year, I was lucky enough to get a good amount of financial aid in addition to scholarships that were awarded to me directly from my college because of my major.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I'm in the situation where I'm from a middle class family don't get nearly the financial aid I feel I should (and most people I talk to feel they're in the same boat). However, I think that those who come from poorer families get enough money so that they can attend college and I think that's very important.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: At such a large school, the processing of documents is a bit slow.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Money could be allocated better.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I received many scholarships and didn't have to take out many loans
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I have found dealing with financial aid a total pain
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I received the leadership scholarship after applying for it. I got to meet my sponsor too which was really nice. I had my tuition waved because my dad retired from the navy with a disability in California
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Berkeley is a fantastic that provides great opportunities after graduation.  school Go Bears!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Currently dealing with financial aid process. It is no easier or harder than expected.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: They don't meet your need if you're out of state
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I am an out of state student who didn't fill out a FAFSA so not getting any financial aid was all my fault.  However I think that good financial assistance is available if you put in the work to get it.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There's so many opportunities offered by the school, whether they are study/review sessions offered, clubs, associations, to research opportunities. Though the student-professor ratio may be low, there are always other people always willing to help you to get through your courses and to get that degree. Most of the people here have been, and still are driven by passion, and will dedicate themselves to achieve their goal. And to be able to share the same feeling is best feeling ever.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: This is one of the top public universities in the nation.  There are so many student opportunities and you study with the best of the best.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: The financial aid process has gone smoothly.  A tip is fill out FAFSA.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Look for work-study and scholarships offered by Cal
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: UC Berkeley doesn't give anywhere near enough financial aid to out of state students.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Berkeley has always been my dream school, and it still is despite the surprises and challenges. I'm trying my hardest to live its standard and mine as well, as Berkeley has always been the symbol for the potential I have, as well as the courage and effort I'm aspired to put into fully realizing the potential and making it a reality.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: For international students, there are very few financial aid opportunities.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are abundant resources available for me to utilize toward applying for an internship or post-grad employment. I feel that when I am done with my undergraduate work, I will have no problem getting connected with potential employers and organizations that fit within my field of focus.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I just filled out forms, and I don't think I was satisfied with the answers financial aid workers gave me.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There are a decent amount of scholarships available, but the scholarship office can be a hassle to deal with at times.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I love Berkeley and feel it was the perfect choice for me!
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: There could be more information given to freshmen on how to afford their education.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Not only do they cover your expenses, they also mentor you in anything you need help with.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Many, infinite amount of resources and connections here in whatever field you choose to do.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I'm able to come here as an out of state student because of the financial aid I received
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The Financial Aid office always has a huge line. If you want to dispute awards, it's hard because there's a lot of paperwork and waiting.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Do taxes early so FAFSA is accurate
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Carier center is not much of a help. Job and internship have to really look for and its a lot of competition.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: As an international student there are minimal opportunities.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I feel that I should get more money for room and board. They offer a lot of money for tuition, but I can not seem to find any grants or anything for room and board. I suggest applying to as many little scholarships as possible because I am not sure the school will be able to meet what you need.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I do not qualify for much aid at all, only about a thousand dollars, so my dealings with the school are just to take out loans which are disbursed in a somewhat timely manner. However, students who receive a lot of aid often report problems of having their funds disbursed when needed.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: For in-state students, the financial aid UC Berkeley offers for those who qualify for it is quite reasonable. However, for out-of-state students, it is much less helpful, considering how much out-of-state tuition costs. Not to mention, Berkeley's prices on attending orientation and other things are completely ludicrous. I have wasted a lot of money and I haven't even started school yet. I would suggest for Berkeley to lower costs on attending orientation (especially when one wishes to bring their guardian figure with them) and to offer more scholarships for financially struggling out-of-state students like myself.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Financial aid office is always busy. Make sure you know what you need to avoid too many trips.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: must put effort into finding money/maintaining grades
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: For an in-state student, who is low-income, I would say it's pretty good. You still have to take out loans, or work. For an out-of-state or international student it is incredibly expensive to go here even with financial aid.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: but definitely hard for international students to get!
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: It is SO hard to get in contact with the financial office through phone, but if you go in person, the process is pretty smooth. They text your phone when they're ready for you and you just go in and get help.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The name "Berkeley" can get you a job practically anywhere. Everyone I know got a job at some sort of well-known company right after graduation.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I didn't get as much money I wanted but I also have work study so it works out.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: As an out-of-state student, I have to pay an out-of-state fee (+22K/year) which, as per University policy, is not considered when the Financial Aid Office disperses money. This is the same for every out-of-state student. Essentially, the additional 22K/year is a fixed cost that my family must face without help every year, barring the help of outside scholarships.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I received some financial aid, but not as much as I needed.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: For middle class, it's hard.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: It is very basic it seems to go through it, but after the first year, it is harder to get scholarships.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Every year, I have problems with financial aid. My first year I wasn't registered for the first weeks of class because there was a glitch in the system and my financial aid didn't come through.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: dont know how i would come here without the aid :)
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: They are hard to get a hold of, like many other systems of the campus- so any little issue that comes up is almost unsolvable unless you're super persistent and constantly available.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The financial aid process seems very straightforward
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Nearly no money was given to me by the University.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The process is fairly easy.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I wish there was a better spectrum of options available for finaid.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review:
1. Apply early. I forgot to send in the signature for my FAFSA and didn't receive aid that year.

2. Try applying even if you think you don't qualify. They've changed a lot of requirements. It could potentially give you a free semester or year of tuition.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: Aid mostly offered to only regent's students and those who fit into minority groups. I didn't find too much available.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Financial aid is a hot mess on crack.  The school is hot to trot to bill students, but will take its sweet time to fix any errors.  Berkeley canceled my financial aid last summer because I did not satisfy a certain requirement (which I did, but the school did not process my information correctly).
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: the financial aid process for me was good and received a good amount of money and was able to convert loans to work study and am doing that. Tips would be to have a good GPA and keep it up so you can be able to qualify
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: The process was easy, but availability isn't the best.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: UC Berkeley is a state school, which means financial aid is scarce. My family does not qualify for financial aid even though we need it, which means I must apply to scholarships and find a job to help support my education.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: UCB is stingy and wants to glean you for all you got.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: It was really smooth and I got the money that I needed to get help paying things off it was really good.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: the scholarship i got when i first came in as a freshman required that I maintain a 3.5 gpa. I got a 3.45 gpa and was very nervous i would lose my scholarship- however, i still received aid. my scholarship simply changed from merit-based to need-based, but was mostly the same amount as before. whew!
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: I have difficulty finding scholarships because of my parent's income bracket
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I did not receive any financial aid from my school, and as a result I am unsure if I will be able to stay all four years necessary to graduate. I find myself planning on taking classes at a community college over the summer to save money. However, I was given the opportunity to have work study, but the job opportunities I have looked at require experience in certain fields, which is hard for a college freshman.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: It's a public university....funding is limited.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Financial aid is easy to obtain, but a bit of a hassle.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The Financial Aid Office is very unorganized and unprofessional and unfortunately have a hard time of answering your questions, they don't know what they are doing. Multiple times, they lost very important papers of mine and it took three months for them to get back to me and for me to receive any aid.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review:
I received financial aid but not enough to cover living expenses or books.
I have taken out $7,500 in loans so far.
I am drowning in debt.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: i ran into a couple of complications that made my life difficult. but there are done and over with now.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I'm an International Student, so I'm not even considered for financial aid, which really sucks, but I guess it makes sense because Berkeley is a public university. However, from what I've heard, financial aid is usually given on a need basis, and people seem to be satisfied with it.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Everything paid! All on merit scholarships, no complaint there.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Thanks to California's financial situation, public schools such as UC Berkeley are not getting adequate funding. As a result,  tuition is increasing and financial aid is becoming more limiting.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Always fill out your Fafsa on time!
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I received some financial aid.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I received a fair amount of financial aid. It was fairly easy to fill out the necessary forms and supply the necessary information, but not a great deal is given in aid.  If there is a true need, there is assistance but it will only take you about 80% of the way. I recommend finding good outside resources to help fill in the remaining 20%.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: I received a $5000 scholarship upon entry to UC Berkeley Optometry school, which helped me to get started, However, I think it would be more helpful to be exposed to scholarships since we are in grad school and We dont have time to look for them online.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Financial Aid is horrible. God forbid that a student has a mishap.  If there is, it takes so long for the mistake to be corrected. Many times, it is not even the student's fault; the Financial Aid Office is just careless.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Decent amount of aid for lower income students but you also have to stay on top of things and make sure you talk to your financial aid officer.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: They give out a lot of financial aid if you are in need. As a in-need student, most of my expenses were covered with fafsa and berkeley grants. Best tip is not to postpone doing the Fafsa so that you have plenty of time to check everything to make sure you get the most
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: The financial aid process is challenging, but it is also achievable. All that you need to do is provide your parents income information though your FAFSA , or yours if you are an independent student. Then you have to wait for your money to go through your school, to your personal account, and then the rest to you. It is basically a waiting game, and if you have all your paperwork in order it should be fine. Always be prompt in providing what ever material is needed of you.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I received a reasonable amount by freshman year regarding financial aid. But this current summer when applying for financial aid for my sophomore year, we ran into more difficulties. The financial aid office only allowed communication through email and made errors in the numbers concerning our tax returns. It was hard to get through to them and correct the error.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Berkeley is a public school, so it's still definitely cheaper compared to private schools. However, with the California government cutting down on education lately, the UC system is definitely impacted, and you can feel it in the financial aid becoming less and less generous.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There's almost no financial aid for students who are perceived to be int he Middle Class.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Even if you think you have all of your financial aid sorted out by reviewing MyFinAid, make sure to call/visit the financial aid office just to make sure you're getting the amount of aid you think you're getting.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: They always take forever to respond to emails. They confuse you quite often when you meet with them in person. The lines are often long and they have terrible chocolate candies in the waiting area. I have not met someone on this campus who has had a great experience with the financial aid processes at this school.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: UC Berkeley just gave me a financial aid package and it all played out.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I have heard that many students use fafsa and that many students end up getting help! Haven't heard much more!
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: I received complete financial aid but it can sometimes be a hassle having to come back now and then because the office miscalculate the amount of money I was supposed to receive.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: There needs to be proactive awareness spread about the risks of loans and that process should be explained in detail.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: As an international student, it's very very difficult to get scholarships. They hardly offer you any, and it's even more expensive for us to enroll here because it's a public school. However, there are many opportunities for US citizens and I heard it's fairly easy to get them.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I received a lot of financial aid, but it is difficult to get through the process. The financial aid office is always extremely busy (line out the door) and you have to reapply every year. The best thing is, however, Cal lets you convert loan offers to work study reward (up to $4000). Berkeley's Work Study Program is very efficient in broadcasting job opportunities for eligible students on-campus, off-campus, and in the surrounding area.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: The Financial Aid office will definitely do all that they can to help you. If you are in serious need of money to attend college, you will get the financial aid you need. If you somehow messed up and spent all you money, you can get quick loans. The Financial Aid office is there for you- you just have to utilize it.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Stellar! I received financial aid every semester, including the summer semester. Be sure to apply for your fafsa early!
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: The bureaucracy is a nightmare. The departments don't communicate with each other enough which leaves you running from one office to the next. They often mess up financial aid distribution, are late, or make mistakes but eventually you get your aid.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Financial Aid office is not very reliable. I've had people tell me conflicting things, I've been charged fees for no reasons and then had to dispute them, and have dealt with rude workers. I have had good experiences with 1 or 2 of the counselors, but I feel it is very rare.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: I received a decent amount of fin aid. It was a difficult process and I wish i could have gotten more fin aid.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The process was lengthy and annoying. Very tedious.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: hard if you're above income. Try for scholarships!
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: For the middle class student, financial aid isn't too beneficial. I received a small amount of aid my freshmen year and then none my sophomore year. They do recommend and appoint you loans. But it is hard to get into contact and directly negotiate your financial aid. But UC Berkeley is a cheaper university as compared to others and you get a lot better quality of an education.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I know that this is a public university, but the tuition is just as expensive as a private college. I did receive some financial aid, but not as much as I had hoped, because of socioeconomic separations, and stuff.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: I am an out-of-state student and financial aid has been a constant source of concern. While the people at the financial aid office are friendly and do try to give as much financial aid as possible, financial aid WILL NOT be given to cover any of the additional out-of-state tuition. Furthermore, it is extremely difficult to become a California resident for tuition purposes while in Berkeley (for example, your parents need to be residents or you need to be financially independent for at least two years, among other options), so please don't count on it.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Just try to be on top of it. Periodically check your financial aid statement online and make sure everything is updated. The financial aid office is great to  work out any kinks in person. Look up scholarship opportunities. Look into student groups that may have scholarship connections or group-specific scholarships. Also, consider a work-study job if you are offered the aid.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I felt that I didn't receive as much financial aid as I deserved. I don't understand why interviews are so important in determining who the "best" students for scholarships are.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Be Early – Submit your FAFSA early. Ask questions early. Search myfinaid early. Submit budget appeals early. And most of all, always show up to the financial aid office EARLY!
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: the online webpage where you process your financial aid is self explanatory and everything is easy to understand. the people who work at the office of financial aid are also super friendly and will help you with anything!
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Its Good! There are definitely scholarships, not as many as I would prefer, but it's all about setting out to find and apply for them!
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Did not receive a good amount of aid. Struggling to pay.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Public Education Is Expensive – Unfortunately because of the budget cuts that the public education sector has been suffering has caused a lot of dilemma and stress on students who are currently attending public education.  The university of california Berkeley has very little money to offer to students so it is a wise idea to apply to a lot of private scholarships.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Not Bad – UC Berkeley is expensive, so getting financial aid is a must.  Usually it isn't too hard to get a Cal grant or a student loan, but be careful when dealing with the financial aid office.  They are like any other government funded program; if it's not 100% clear, they'll find a way to disqualify it.  I guess it's just a matter of doing your research and making sure you are on top of things at all times.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Very Confusing – Applying for aid is simple, just complete the FAFSA form, but getting can become overly complicated. It is a series of payments and refunds. They arrive in such a way that you cannot always tell which amount is from which scholarship. Also, aid money can get taken away even after the office has paid it to you.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: For those who are not destitute or a prodigy in academics, it is difficult to earn a scholarship since UCB houses the best of the best. If your full tuition isn't covered even with loans, the Work Study program is an exellent way to earn extra money for school. With work study, you receive priority in on campus job placement. I suggest job hunting in the first few weeks of every semester because the best jobs (LIBRARY!!) do fill up fast!
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Fin Aid Needs to Be More Accessible – they re open at hours that are difficult for students to make because of classes and the people that work there are extremely inflexible and have no empathy for students
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: I got a pretty good amount for financial aid for which it paid for most of the tuition. But in the end I still ended up taking out some loans to make up for the difference. I suggest you fill out the FAFSA form as soon as possible and do not wait till the last moment to turn it in for which there is a limited amount of money that is dispersed among many other students who need the aid.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The school take time to review students financial need and are generous with Academic and Financial Status scholarships.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Fiancial Aid Berkeley – I received a good amount of financial aid and it seemed reasonable to pay. Additionally, I applied to a lot of the scholarships offered by the school and I received one so I had to pay less money. The Financial Aid office was very easy to go too, there is generally a lot of people but the line goes by quickly.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Somewhat Frustrating – The financial department is generally less than accommodating. They can take too much time to answer calls, respond to calls/e-mails, and taking and refunding money.
Value.Author: College Junior

Value.Review: Just Apply! Just apply for Finicial Aid. Especialy if you are in need of support.
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: More Loans Than Grants – I received more loans than I did Grants even though my family makes a little less then 24,000 a year. This is why I am forced to sign up for Scholarships.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: It is terrible at berkeley. Hard to get, unorganized, and the people who do get it abuse the system
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Seemingly Simple, but Huge Hiccups – Appyling for financial aid is very straightforward. All students need to do is file FAFSA before March 2. Receiving your financial aid package is a little more complicated. If problems arise, students can visit the financial aid office, but the wait is often long and frustrating
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Could Have Been Better – I went in to talk to the financial aid advisers once and was disappointed. The advisers that are available do not really know much about how the process works since they do not process the information but rather collect and resubmit to others who analyze and crunch out numbers. I asked how my financial aid package would work and what I should expect and the answer I received was, "This should be okay, but I cannot guarantee anything. You'll receive your offer in a few months." And so I say, it could have been better.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: There are many scholarship opportunities, just go on Cal's finaid website. You have to take the initiative to look for them.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: I received no financial aid whatsoever no grant or any kind. However i did receive the Cal Veterans fee reduction aid which help a ton with tuition but not with books, food, or housing. My FAFSA assumed that my parents would be capable of paying for my college, but that is absolutely not the case. Now i'm stuck with pulling out loans. I strongly agree with making an appointment with your financial aid counselors even if you don't get financial aid so you can understand how to get loans and the details surrounding it..
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The school generally lacks much funding and thus outside of financial aid there aren't many options outside of loans. The financial aid office is poor and the service is extremely slow.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: No Problems – Having taken loans for financial aid, I have not had any problems applying for or receiving the loans.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Berkeley Is Losing Money – With the state facing financial difficulties, the school is making some drastic budget cuts while also introducing tuition and increasing fees. Although I still receive financial aid to cover about 75% of my costs, I've heard the financial aid will diminish. Scholarships are hard to find.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: It's Easier Than It Looks – Just do it.  It's there, and if you apply, you'll probably get it.  The biggest problem is when people feel like it's too much trouble, but if you think of it in different terms, it almost seems too good to be true.  I receive about 12,000 a year, for about ten hours' work.  SO worth it.  The main thing is to go to the office and talk to people, call the phone numbers and ask questions, and to get everything in on time.  There should be no problems at all, but if there are, the people there will do everything they can to keep you at Berkeley.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: Well getting financial aid is easily. Once you have your berkeley account you get alotted a certain amount. In Fall, it takes forever for your financial aid to pay out. It changes frequently and something worries you because it drops. Eventually it gets fixed and then it gets paid out. In Spring, its much faster and smoother.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: The financial aid office needs to reminded of your existence, but, as long as they know you are willing to take the effort and need the money, they will help as much as they can.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Get Good Grades, U'll Get Money – It wasn't bad. They do an excellent job awarding you your grant
Value.Author: College Senior

Value.Review: Scholarship Issues. There were some issues with some aid I was getting from an outside source but it was resolved with the help of the scholarship not the school.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Financial Support – It has been extremely hard this year for me to attend Berkeley. I have not received any financial aid from the school.
Value.Author: College Sophomore

Value.Review: 8% Rise in Tuition – As an out of state student, tuition is very expensive. Berkeley offered me only a little bit of aid, and the financial aid office is alway jammed packed with students waiting to be helped.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Value.Review: Okay but Limited "Free" Money – If you fill out the FAFSA on time you will be able to get aid offered to you. It is a public school, so they don't give out too many scholarships in the financial aid offer. The free money mostly goes to people with "financial need." If you aren't considered to have "financial need" they mostly just offer you loans. It is not like many private schools where there is a lot of free money for things like academic achievement.
Value.Author: Recent Alumnus

Value.Review: Impossible for Out-Of-Staters – Berkeley is great for California residents and athletes - who are getting an amazing education at low cost - but if you're coming from out of state expect to pay the full sticker price for tuition. There is almost no opportunity for aid and they don't offer National Merit scholarships.
Value.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: This also gets repetitive after a while and off campus dining is usually more expensive.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Dining halls are pretty good in terms of healthy options, but everything gets boring and repetitive after a while.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There is something for everyone, from Julie's Cafe and Blondie's Pizza on Southside to Urban Turbann and La Val's Pizzeria on Northside.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The meal plan choices are affordable and the food itself is pretty good, with a whole array of options to choose from.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The Bay has the best food.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: There are nice, ethnic, diverse places all throughout Berkeley with reasonable prices. There are quite a few places with student discounts and the food never gets old. There are many alternative options to meet any dietary needs and the small restaurants are very understanding and accepting.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: All of the dining halls serve different items so it is nice to go online and choose in advance. Foothill is definitely one of my favorites and it is near my dorm. Crossroads is also good for brunch because it has a variety of options. Another way to use meal points is at the Cal Bear Café where you can buy coffee and other small snack items.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I enjoyed my dining experiences.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: I have gotten food at the Golden Bear Diner, the Berkeley Faculty Club, the Crossroads, the Ramona Cafe, and some of the surrounding restaurants on Telegraph and Hearst. The Berkeley Faculty Club makes good hamburgers, the person who makes them is very friendly, and the S.F. Soup Company makes very good soups. However, the Golden Bear Diner does not always have the Dove Dark Chocolate bars, and I feel that they could have larger cups for their soups.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: I regularly go to the S.F. Soup Company for lunch, and I really like their soups. I also sometimes go to the Saturn Cafe. Their food is good, but they are pretty expensive. In addition, I've gone to the Northside Cafe. Although their soups are good and are cheaper than S.F. Soup, you cannot sample Northside's soups. I've also had lunch at the Aki Japanese restaurant, but while their food is good, they do not have great service and are not particularly friendly. When I went to Cafe Milano for hot chocolate, they did not give me whipped cream with the hot chocolate, and when I called them on the phone afterward about the matter, the person on the phone was very unfriendly. Finally, I sometimes go to Chipotle for lunch, and their food is good.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Campus food is nothing compared to the other amazing restaurants you have at your disposal living in Berkeley (top city for food). However, it is not impossible to eat. I had foothill most times because it was closest to me- food was great on special occasions. Other times you would have the same food for the whole day. It gets tiring after a while. I would advise you to spend your meal points on dining food however go out and eat at other places that accept meal points so that you can get a wide range of selection
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Off campus food is amazing! There is a wide range of elections from thai, indian, Chinese, Korean to Mexican food.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are a lot of dining options off-campus. Usually they are pretty affordable and good. Definitely ethnically diverse. Always conveniently available and open late hours after dining commons close.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I am very grateful for meal points. I can use them around different dining halls and cafes that accept meal points. There is always variety. There is a new ASUC app that is very handy because it allows us to view different dining hall menus.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Berkeley has one of the best restaurant options in America. Ranging from cheap fillers to expensive quality food and everything in between
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is not that bad and there are many places you can go to eat
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's really great to see small local restaurants around here. The food scene here is fantastic.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: When you're no longer a freshman, the dining halls are a godsend.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of really good ethnic food off campus. Most meals will run about $8. Some of the best places are Brazil Cafe, Mount Everest, Indian Flavors Express, and Racha Cafe.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: The best thing about campus food is late night. Everything is served a la carte, but the food is so much better and it's perfect for late night's after studying or partying!
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Very expensive overall, but a lot of cute little places that serve good food
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Very affordable and close by
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Ramonas and pat browns are the best. Snacks and groceries are super overpriced. Crossroads has the same thing everyday.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Berkeley is the best place for food! I love eating out.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Its not the best food but it is not bad at a ll and they many healthy options. The only thing is that it gets kind of repetitive after a while.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Berkeley's local food is truly stunning. Every street really is packed with restaurants, all vying for your hard earned cash. The variety is huge, so the trick is to find your favorite couple of places and just enjoy them whenever you can.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Lots of options out there, undoubtedly. That said, they aren't always the best/most diverse. Honestly, I'm sure the campus food quality is on par with every other college out there, but the sheer amazingness of off-campus dining overshadows Cal's most sincere efforts.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: I wish the campus food was a little cheaper, but I got along just fine using the dining halls for most of my meals and occasionally having a small breakfast or lunch on campus.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: There's always something to satisfy a craving.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The food is pretty generic. The options get old really fast. However, it does the job.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Great off campus food. High cost though
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: If you go here, understand the food will be pretty mediocre. Pray that you don't have to deal with Foothill everyday.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: So much variety! You can find everything you'd ever want to eat here
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Typical cafeteria food, but there are many locations
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The off-campus dining in Berkeley is amazing. Any cuisine you can think of is available and there are tons of late night options.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food can get repetitive but there is always a way to switch it up. Overall the dining halls are not that bad.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: its pretty good but eating out gets expensive and not really worth it
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is honestly gross. You will probably end up spending most of your points on coffee
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is amazing!! There are so many options for anything you are in the mood for. There are also different price ranges, depending on how much you want to spend.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The dining halls are not great, but its really awesome being able to use meal points at Peet's coffee. Also, meal points can be  used at Bear Market, where you can basically buy any groceries you need. I have the standard meal plan and I still have a lot of points left over.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There is a variety of off-campus dining. Many people from out of town come to these places to eat because they serve good food and at a low cost.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: All dining commons offer a variety of food choices for each meal. It can sometimes get repetitive at times, but overall, it satisfies me.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are tons of independent restaurants all around campus, though not a lot of chain restaurants. They cater towards students so they're reasonably priced and have good hours. I like the vibe of the restaurants and the idea that I'm supporting local businesses.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review:
I eat at Cafe 3 almost every day and it's adequate. They have sufficient options and because it's all you can eat, you certainly never go hungry. My main complaint is that the food is kind of bland and not as healthy as home cooking might be, but what more can you ask for in a dining hall?

I also often get food from Qualcom and Bear Market and am happy with both, although Bear Market seems a bit pricey.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is very good and pretty affordable. However, service can be a bit slow considering how little free time I have.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I would be disappointed with campus dining if I had not heard that dining hall food was not nearly the best part of college life from countless adults.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's healthier than restaurants outside.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food in Berkeley is simply amazing. Cheap, lots of options, and large portion sizes.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The smoothies especially are very very good. There is a decent amount of healthier options.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The bay area has some of the best food, and pretty reasonable prices
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: There are a lot of options off campus and the options on campus are pretty good.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Everything is just a walk away. My favorite food is pizza and there a TON of pizza options. My favorite is a little pricey but its called BUILD, I highly suggest it.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I use my meal points to get Pete's coffee everyday. My meal points cover all the meals I eat on campus. I only go grocery shopping for snacks. There's a lot of quick and healthy food options on campus.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of options in price, quality, offerings, ethnic choices.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: It was OK but I would have preferred more options, more fresh food.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I have always been very satisfied with the local dining options in Berkeley.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: SO MUCH GOOD FOOD IN THE BAY
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is all right for the first couple weeks and then it gets super redundant
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I love the food places around here! The hours are usually convenient for students as well, with a lot of places open until midnight or even later.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: The food is typical college dorm food quality- it's not the greatest, but you're being fed multiple times a day, so who cares.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: There are tons of restaurants in Berkeley, especially if you are willing to walk or take the bus to get to the Elmwood area or downtown Berkeley you can get any type of food you want at a decent price.  Also there are a bunch of restaurants like Artichoke Pizza and La Burrita that are open very late on the weekends.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Campus food is very average, the dining halls have a lot of options but everything gets pretty boring after a couple months, which is to be expected.  I personally hate the GBC because they serve a ton of junk food there and it's usually crowded. That said, the new student union is opening up next year and is supposed to have even more good food options.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I've liked the places that I've tried so far. There are plenty of boba places and places for sweets like ice cream, cookies, and gelato.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I appreciate the buffet-style dining in the dining halls because I can really get my money's worth out of each meal, but I have heard some students have gotten food poisoning from the campus food. Also, the dining halls are very slow to fix broken machinery such as the frozen yogurt machines.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of options and readily available on every section of the huge campus.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: If you have money and a car it's great!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Foothill would have to be the best out of all of them.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are discounts if you use your student ID.  There are usually many different types of restaurants in a close radius which makes it convenient.  There are a lot of options.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Sheng Kee Bakery (good value on drinks); menchie's frozen yogurt!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: vegan/vegetarian options always available and usually decent; low variety; too many meal points restrict your dining options
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Many great and diverse places to eat!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of options near dorms
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Dining hall food is hit or miss but the city of Berkeley is foodie paradise.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Off campus dining is great. There's lots of variety and you can get whatever you want to eat pretty easily.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Campus food options are great and are readily available whenever you want a bite to eat
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's usually good. There are 4 dining halls, but one of them is much worse compared to the others.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: They're very convenient and cheap.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are some really great spots to grab food in Berkeley. I especially love Asian Ghetto, which seems to have food from all over the world in one convenient little spot.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Although there are plenty of options for dining at Cal, the overall freshness and quality of the food is not too great.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: You'll never run out of places to try.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Not the best but not the worst.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: the off campus dining isn't amazing, but there are still a lot of great spots and it's best to do it with friends so you both get that first time experience!

Food.Review: Amazing restaurants within walking distance or short bus ride of campus

Food.Review: Everything is pretty close together- especially on Telegraph. The meals are decently priced and the portions are a good size.

Food.Review: A  lot of restaurants and small take out places to eat. You won't be hungry
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: There are a lot of options!
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Personally, I think that on-campus dining is enough to get through the year. However, on late nights it is fun to go get whatever one is craving. Cost is average - ranging from $6 to $12.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are so many different restaurants to choose from. I'm able to always have something new to try. The prices are decent, but some can get a little high, especially for students.

Food.Review: Plenty of restaurants on all sides of campus. Cost is very reasonable wherever you go.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The restaurants are very diverse and offer pretty good quality
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are multiple dining halls and options within each. The foods are diverse in culture and they're decently made.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are so many different types of food to eat all over the place!
Food.Author: College Sophomore
