Food.Review: A lot of people complain about the food but honestly I like it. I think people just get tired of it and probably just miss home cooked meals but i'm usually pretty satisfied with the dining hall food. There's usually at least one thing i like and I dont really need more.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The campus dining halls are buffet style so you can eat as much as you want, although you can get sick of it after a while and crave homecooking.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Berkeley pretty much has restaurants everywhere you look. There have Asian, Mexican, Brazilian, Mediterranean, Italian. You name it. There is a Dot Island Grill across from campus, which I think serves pretty good and healthy Hawaiian food and you can get a 10% discount when using your student ID or you can get their daily special for only $5. There are way too many places to get boba in Berkeley though. I think there are about 10 close to campus. Other than that there are a wide variety of affordable places to eat in Berkeley.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: There are some fantastic restaurants within blocks of the school.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: The off campus dining is pretty good. There is a lot of variety around. They open very late, so it's also very convenient. The prices are also manageable.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I ate at the University's dinning hall when i was a freshmen. Students often claim that the food is bad, but i quite liked it. I ate a lot at Crossroad. It's buffet system , so you can eat as much as you want. If you want to eat healthier, there is always salad booth.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I have no other place to compare Berkeley to, but I believe that overall, Berkeley's off-campus dining is definitely not a disappointment.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I've visited many colleges, and I'm not sure there are many that rival Berkeley's selection of off-campus dining. There are some great places to try (Cheese Board, CREAM, Ici, I.B.'s to name a few) that are all within walking distance of campus, or if you're lazy within a bus ride. Fenton's is in Oakland with a bus that goes right next to it, and it's worth trying. The prices can be a bit high in some of the better restaurants, but there are great places to eat that are also cheap. Quince Cafe offers a delicious, cheap brunch, and Gypsy's is also a good deal on Italian food near campus. Asian Ghetto and Gourmet Ghetto are perfect for different, tasty experiences.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: I've seen worse. At least there are some healthy options, Clark Kerr and Foothill offer some decent food, and late night food is offered on weekends at a couple of the dining halls. Bear Market is great for spending the rest of your meal points when you have an excess at the end of the semester. However, the meals are actually overpriced in general, and when you live off campus, you can save a large amount of money by not having a meal plan.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The dining halls have absolutely horrendous hours. The food is bland, redundant, and very often ill-suited to special diets (vegan, kosher, etc.). Foothill has the only decent menu, but it is very out of the way for most students.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: I love the food at Berkeley. There are so many different type of ethnic restaurants to try!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is alright, but becomes boring way too fast. I lived right next to crossroads, so that was obviously the worst place to eat in my opinion. In reality the food isn't that bad, but everyone likes to complain because they always eat there.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The on-campus food is not that great, and it costs so much for no reason.  It makes no sense that the school wants to overprice food, and students are already paying an arm and a leg just to be students.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There's plenty of options here as far as food goes. As anything else in this area, it's not the cheapest. There are late-night spots though!
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: A lot of places to try, all close to campus and student housing.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The menu is pretty diverse, but the quality could be better.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of options but wish there were more vegan
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: For a college town, Berkeley has great food options. I visited many other campuses while I was here and nothing else compares to the restaurant scene except maybe UCSF and NYU.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots and lots of options with restaurants from a variety of cuisines.  Lots of healthy options too.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Lots of places to eat, including Asian options
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I question the quality but it is quite affordable for students. There are many varieties to choose from!
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There's a lot of good places but they are a little pricey
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review:
The food is BOMB.

1. There is a lot of it. Any type of cuisine you can think of, from Thai to Italian to Ethiopian, we got it. 

2. Vegan options? Vegetarian options? Options that involve a specific species of fish? We practically invented them. WE HAVE A RESTAURANT THAT'S ALL RAW FOOD.

3. It's all good. Even if it's not good, you'll find a restaurant next door that makes you forget any bad restaurant experience.

4. It's pretty cheap. A dinner option usually comes around $7-9.

5. Berkeley made me fat.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Most things around campus are cheap and definitely walking distance so that's awesome. For restaurants/cafes that are a bit farther you can take the bus usually your student bus pass. I would check out Crepes-A-Go-Go, D'Yar, La Note, and Philz Coffee.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The food is endless, and there is so much ethnic cuisine! It is wonderful, but I do wish there were student discounts.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is a great price, and the variety is amazing. I love that there are vegan and vegetarian options everywhere; it is easy to stay healthy while staying satisfied.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Lots of places close to campus. Most are pricey for students though (>$7), it's important to scout out places that you can afford. Plenty of great locations to eat at if you can splurge one in a while (south end of College, north Shattuck, Solano).
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review:
Some places are open late, and at places like the "Asian Ghetto", you get bargain prices and food is decent. 

However, I do not think most places take student discounts, which a little disappointing.

Service is decent too. 

I  don't eat out very much so my response is not very representative of the overall experiences of Off campus dining.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It is very important to remember that Berkeley is a city; therefore, parking is outrageous.  Parking spots are so rare, and the rates are ridiculous.  Parking cops are quick to write a ticket if the driver goes over his or her time.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I love how diverse the off campus dining is. You can find any type of food anywhere
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: There are several local places and some well known chain ones as well. Many offer cal-card discounts and payment option.
Food.Author: College Student

Food.Review: There are so many awesome places to eat around campus and around the city! Not something to miss out on. Definitely a Berkeley plus.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Many diverse and ethnic options.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: Off-campus dining is amazing. Pretty much whatever you want is going to only be a few blocks from campus. Most joints are very well priced(with the exception of Chipotle). Some examples of the off campus dining choices, Asian-Ghetto(a small circle of cheap but delicious Asian and Mexican food), Purple Kow( A bubble tea joint with supposedly the best bubble tea), bubble tea is everywhere off campus. We also have many bakeries with delicious and excellent priced pastries. We have Cream( ice cream sandwiches that are said to be really good, Cream is open late and has reasonable prices, but there is normally a very long line). Crepes A Go-Go is a crepe joint right off the campus, but its pretty expensive. We have Noahs bagels( which is really good). The best food options would be on Shattuck(5min bus ride, or 15 min walk from campus). There is a really good Thai place, Paris Baguette is an amazing pastry shop, there is a Starbucks, and a McDonnalds. Vegetarian options are everywhere. Almost any  place you go they will have vegetarian options in their own section on the menu and vegan options are also very abundant. Student discounts are not offered very often however, though we do have a Cal1Card that can be used at a few places off campus and there are coupons you can find that only work if you use the Cal1Card. For example Jamba Juice had a buy 1 get 1 free if you use the Cal1Card(debit account not meal points).
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I have visited Top Dog, and it was a pretty amazing hotdog. The cost was okay, but I would definitely go again.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: there is a LOT of variety of food off campus here! many different cultures of foods are represented here. no shortage!
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: The food is not well seasoned so it tastes very bland.Apart from that I personally feel that the food tends to be too oily and there are more fast foody options than fruits or greens.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are so many restaurants near campus that I would prefer to not have meal points and be able to eat out, choosing from a variety of places.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: During my first month at UC Berkeley, I was very excited to be able to eat at a buffet-style dining common every night - there is a wide variety of foods to choose from, and each dining hall has a different menu every night. However, I discovered that after a month of eating in the same dining hall every night, I became sick of the food and need more variety. I find myself buying food from markets, or skipping meals entirely, rather than forcing myself to eat food I have began to dislike. Although the food at my specific dining hall has become boring to me, I still enjoy eating at the other dining halls throughout campus, it's just a matter of whether or not you are too lazy to get the food like me.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are great restaurants off campus. I usually go to Durant Square where my favorite italian food place is located (GYPSYS) and there is also vietnamese, mexican, chinese and etc.. Right across the street there is a hamburger place called Alec's which is also really healthy, they promote their hamburgers to be the healthiest and delicious and they are! Food is everywhere in Berkeley, across campus we also have a Jamba juice, Yogurtland, and Best Soups of San Francisco!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It gets old, not a lot of good places only really good place is chipotle( in my opinion), that and dominos.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's just ok, nothing awesome just a lot of the same whatever food.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's hit and miss and almost all of the dining locations on campus that accept meal points. Russian Roulette for your stomach.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review:
There's a rumor that the city of Berkeley used to have a rule about having no chain restaurants in the city, which it has since disbanded. Most of the restaurants around campus are small businesses with decent food, but the few chain restaurants they have are disappointing (Subway, Jamba Juice, McDonalds, Starbucks, Peets, etc.). 
Unless you want to pay a lot of money, you're stuck with the cheap food around Berkeley and it gets old really fast. Most of the food falls into one of four categories: Asian food, Indian food, Pizza, or Burgers. There is no good Mexican, Italian, or American food around campus, though there are some great dessert places such as King Pins for donuts and Cream for Ice cream. 
All in all, the food is ok. There are a few places that are really good, but besides those, the food options are pretty ok.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Berkeley has great food. Period. It is awesome and there are tons of restaurants so you never get bored. If you are looking for a place to have a nice romantic dinner, there are several in the downtown area that have won many awards and if you are searching for some inexpensive great food there are tons of options for that too! There is something for everyone here.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Sometimes the food can get boring if you have too much of the same thing, but there are many different options available. Students can choose things that are healthy or delicious.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Dining halls suck for food options but there are good cheap places around campus that are open pretty late.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Always something new to try
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Restaurants on campus are so much better than the dining halls. But, both are extremely overpriced.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: The Gourmet Ghetto is amazing!
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Rarely serves halal, which is surprising
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There's plenty of potential options of things to eat.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Best. College. Town.  Ever.  Also, there's a Thai place about every two blocks and a ton of places deliver (great for midterms/finals.)
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The way I see it: No matter where you go, three quarters into your freshman year you'll be tired of the dining halls. I'd rather be tired of Berkeley's than of most anywhere else's. I've visited a lot of other schools' dining halls and with the possible exception of UCLA I think Berkeley's are the best. (UCLA's food is a little richer and more savory, but I like the lightness of options here. I walk out of the dining hall feeling heavier at UCLA than at Berkeley.)
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are numerous dining halls and lots of locations where you can eat to go. However, the menus are very repetitive and you become tiresome of eating the same food.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: So many great places to eat off campus...Durant Food Court is always popular.  I don't usually go on the west side of campus, but there are lots of places there too.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Always lots of choices but not always the greatest food!
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review:
Everything is expensive. 
Lots of diversity but no discounts for students.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review:
Lots of options at UC Berkeley.
However, food is expensive, wish there were lost-cost options.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Cafe 3 and Crossroads are beautiful dining complexes that make eating and enjoying the landscape easy and relaxing. They do switch their entrees every once in a while, however, they cycle through a finite number of recipes. They do not offer quality ethnic food, but the food they do offer is satisfactory enough.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Cal Dining is generally pretty good. There are always many vegan/vegetarian options, including an all-organic salad bar! You can also use your meal points to buy coffee, protein bars, sandwiches, etc at the retail stores. You can even buy things like dish soap at Bear Market. From Wednesday through Saturday, there is also 'Late Night', however the food there is pretty unhealthy. I think even the pickiest person can find something to eat at the Dining Commons.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are unlimited ways to use your meal points around Berkeley. You can use them in one of the four dining halls which are placed all around campus so everyone can have access, in the cafes which also scatter the school, or for coffee and fresh produce that are available throughout the year in the center of campus. The dining halls have a varying degree of vegan and gluten free options depending on where you choose to eat but there will always be at least one. You can also use your meal points to purchase snacks, toiletry items, and even yoga mats at the Cub Markets and Recreational Sports Facility stores.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The cultural diversity in Berkeley extends to its food options! There is a restaurant for everyone and the cuisine is incredibly varied, including in price.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Food here is really cheap!
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I love all of the boba places here.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Dining at Berkeley is great.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: a never-ending supply of diverse options.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The little cafés along Bancroft have the best sandwiches, at a decent price; it's the best solution for me to get a quick meal in on my lunch break between classes. Cafe Strada also has an awesome fruit and yogurt parfait, it's my "go to" snack because I can taste that it's healthy for me, the yogurt and granola aren't loaded with sugar and the fruit is fresh!
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Places close to campus are delicious and cheap
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The dining on campus accommodates a lot of different diets but the food quality isn't always the best.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Off-campus dining near the school is phenomenal and diverse.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The food options are excellent. The dorms provide enough and the local neighborhoods provide even more.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: Foothill's food has gotten worse, but there is still made-on-the-spot crepes on Saturdays. Food ranges from good to downright bad.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: You can not find more variety in such a small area.  You can get food with any budget, but you get what you pay for.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There is no shortage of places to eat on campus or in the surrounding areas. The campus dining is diverse and healthy but is a little overpriced. If you are using a Meal Points system it is best to regulate your spending and monitor it closely. The dining halls are great and are all you can eat, but you may get tired of it after a while. I suggest getting the meal plan if you are living in On-Campus Housing if only for the convenience and the variety. It's included so you might as well use it.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: I love the off campus dining options here at UC B. Bancroft is full of restaurant of different food and prices. There is indian food, sushi, greek food, soup and salad bar...it keeps meals interesting.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Berkeley has a variety of restaurants to offer. Lots of Indian, Greek, Thai, Afro-Caribbean, Japanese, etc. food choices. Walking down major streets such as Telegraph, College, and Shattuck avenues will lead you to these yummy eateries!
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Good availability but you can get tired of it really fast.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I'm a vegetarian, so I did not eat everything there. There was always healthy options and a salad bar. There wasn't a great option for vegetarians though.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: It's pretty decent but sometimes you have to opt out of it for better, hearty meals off campus.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: It has many dining options off-campus. It's great.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Although the dining halls may not be the best in the nation, they definitely are not bad. One of the aspects that make Berkeley such an amazing city to live in is that THERE IS SO MUCH GOOD FOOD EVERYWHERE. It blew my mind how many local hole-in-the-wall restaurants there were that served amazingly delicious and authentic food. The culture that revolve around good food is top notched, and is probably only rivaled by cities like SF (which is only a 20 minute BART ride away) and NY.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Different type of ethnicity food, everywhere is food, and is easy access for students.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are such a variety of restaurants within walking distance from campus
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: So many great and affordable restaurants around campus and downtown! Lots of cheap and late night options available within walking distance of the dorms and the famous, as well as nicer restaurants a start walk or a bus ride away to Shattuck or the Gourmet Ghetto.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: UC Berkeley has this huge push for organic foods, which in my opinion, drives me crazy.  There are so many vegan options in the dining halls that it is ridiculous.  However, there are foods that are rather flavorful.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The places around campus are good. There are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops. You will never be hungry!
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The options available are very healthy, but sometimes the food can get repetitive.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are tons of restaurants within walking distance all around the campus. You won't really find a fast food joint here, but you will always discover an amazing restaurant tucked in the corner somewhere.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There is a great amount of diversity and options when it comes to eating in Berkeley. Eating out is definitely one of the best parts about going to the school. The eateries are a main attraction of the city so they are always lively and there is every kind of restaurant from McDonald's to sushi joints to Nigerian food trucks to choose from on ant given day. If you don't want to go to a restaurant their are a good number of dining halls and little food cafes on and around campus to choose from as well.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The dining halls are stocked with plenty of food, although like any dining hall, the food is not top quality and gets old quickly. I would give our dining halls a B+ because of their convenient locations and ample supply of food.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: People around the world will tell you that Berkeley is truly one of the best places for off-campus food. Whatever ethnic cuisine you desire, there are probably four or five options to choose from within a walking distance. Certainly try new places besides the favored Thai Basil, Top Dog, and Cheeseboard. Finefine, Indian Flavors Express, and Brazil Cafe offer equally splendid experiences.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: I tried food at the dining halls a few times here and there (I had a campus apartment which was a blessing because I had a kitchen). I was not impressed and found the quality not good at all at the dining hall I tried (Crossroads), except for late night. I have heard that Foothill has good food.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: There are many unique food at Berkeley, including the best spaghetti restaurant I have been to in my life. Many restaurants are family owned, which can make a difference in the atmosphere than most restaurants. Cheeseboard Pizza is a must if you are visiting Berkeley. Be ready to stand in a line that's almost a block long -- it's that popular and delicious.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The school greatly recognizes the importance of vegetarian options. The general dining hall food is not so delicious but they have a lot of healthy options. Nevertheless, most students, including me, don't choose to eat at the dining hall everyday, but they do have some nice options for special occasions.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: There are so many options! Around the dorm area you will find a lot of fast-food meals and further in the Downtown Berkeley area you can find more sit-in diners and restaurants for those weekend nights.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: I love how there are so many health food stores around the area.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The food around Berkeley is fantastic. You have to leave the area next to the dorms and campus to really appreciate all the amazing options in the city. Most places like Bongo Burger are regularly priced costing between 6 and 10 dollars. Some places can get expensive like Angeline's on Shattuck. Also, if you love Thai food, then Berkeley is the city for you since there is an abnormal amount of Thai restaurants which are all at least decent. Also, it is so easy to get to Oakland and SF so the great places there are also options.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: It's average but bearable.  Gets old after about 3 weeks.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: I feel like the campus eateries are very standard. They are all decent but compared to the off-campus restaurants nothing really stand out to me.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Thai Basil, near Berkeley's Asian Ghetto, is probably the best affordable Thai eatery around. I tend to get the pineapple fried rice, the Tum-yum Kha with noodle soup, the combination soup, and their pad see ew. They're all under $8 and very delicious. The only problem is that their isn't a lot of seating and is almost always crowded with people.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There is such a diversity and abundance of eateries around campus. Just along one block of Durant Ave., you'll find Chinese, Italian, Korean, Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Japanese, Thai, Mexican, Indian, and good 'ol 'murican food, along with a couple of boba cafes. Everywhere, the cost is reasonable, the quality is at least above average. Many places are also vegetarian/vegan-friendly. The Asian Ghetto is a popular place. If you go several blocks down College Ave. or to Downtown Berkeley, there are many good places to check out. No matter what the parameters, you're bound to find something you like.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: there are a lot of options, for food. Most of the food varies from 7 to 10 dollars. There is Chinese, sushi, pizza, thai, just about anything
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The dining halls get pretty boring, but there is a lot of good food in the area.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are a lot of places to eat on and around campus. It's easy to grab food in between classes or sit down in one of the three dining halls. All the menus offer vegetarian and vegan options, so it's easy to maintain that lifestyle should you prefer.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Food just as good as San Francisco but about 30% cheaper on average.
Food.Author: Recent Alumnus

Food.Review: At first the food is bearable, but halfway through the semester everything just tastes gross. Some days I would actually rather eat top ramen in my room but others I find myself wanting to go back for seconds. The dining halls are very hit and miss, unfortunately more of the time a miss than a hit.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The food is just ok but after a while you realize that the quality isn't that great.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Theres a great variety but the food is somewhat mediocre. Thai, Chinese, Indian, Mexican, Japanese, and then good ol pizza and burgers are available. No fast food restaurants, unless you have a car, then you can drive to oakland for taco bell, kfc, mickey d's, etc. Theres a good mix of low end and higher end too.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The dining commons are good compared to other schools even though students like to complain about them.  It is pretty easy to eat healthy here given the salad bars and the chefs commitment to decently healthy food.  You can also go to a bunch of great local restaurants on telegraph, durant and shattuck.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Outside dining is great. Dorm food gets bland and sometimes is not very good tasting.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are many places to choose from. A lot are asian food
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: The dining halls are great about providing healthy choices and alternatives to meat and dairy. I love trying all the new recipes; Cal definitely has some talented people in the kitchen! The best places are the I-House on their good days and the CKC dining hall. They have the best food. Clark Kerr in particular, has the healthiest foods since we have so many athletes here. On campus, there are several places to buy great things with meal points. You can also get some neat discounts on places like Jamba Juice if you use you student ID debit. There are even some hidden coffee places in some buildings. My favorite is Pete's in Dwinelle. It's a friendly place to get some studying done!
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: There are a lot of different places to eat around campus so I think you're bound to find a favorite spot. Some are on the cheaper side while others are more expensive.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Sometimes, the dining halls are good, but a lot of times they aren't. You don't always find everything posted on the menus, and the food isn't always as good as you hope/expect it to be.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Residential food definitely tends towards quantity over quality. Food is bland, tasteless, and fairly greasy. There's a lot of vegetarian and vegan options though. On campus food is a little better seasoned, but it's incredibly overpriced for the amount of food that you're getting, unfortunately. Same with packaged foods like their sandwiches and various drinks. Qualcomm used to take meal points for their coffee though, which was nice on a cold or stressful day. I'm not sure if they still accept mealpoints.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: There are so many choices, there is alot of variety and the quality is good.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are so many choices for food in Berkeley, very close to campus.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: It's very decent but I wouldn't say that it's the best
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: On-campus dining is pretty mediocre. Crossroads and Cafe 3 are the two biggest dining halls, and the food is pretty bland and not easy to be healthy at all. Some of the smaller on-campus options are decent, such as Golden Bear Cafe, and there are some Peet's coffee shops that use meal points, which is nice. But overall, don't expect anything special. The menus at the dorms' dining halls get old VERY fast, and you start looking for any excuse to eat somewhere else.
Food.Author: College Senior

Food.Review: Berkeley is known for its incredible food. The off campus foods are cheap, convenient, and absolutely fantastic. Anything you could desire, whether it be Thai, Indian, Mexican, or something in between, is just a short walk away.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: Dining halls are what you would expect from a college: not fantastic, but it's still pretty edible. Some places are better than others. However, if you are unsatisfied with them, there are a lot of great restaurants around the city, whether it's right by campus or downtown, all within reasonable walking distance.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The Costs can range anywhere from fast food prices to classy restaurants. The quality if you look for it can be great. There are few places with organic ingredients however most breakfast places serve fresh squeezed orange juice. Jupiter's is great for later dinners and theres a bar there as well as salsa on thursday nights and they have a fire pit outside. Crepe's A Go Go is a very filling and quick breakfast place not too pricy about $6 or $7 per crepe.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: The dining halls get old pretty fast, and  the food is average. Some days the food is much better than on average. The variety is actually not all that bad, and there are vegan and vegetarian options. There are plenty of places to use your meal points on-campus besides the dining halls during the day. The Late Night menu at Crossroads is decent and is what students spend most of their meal points on. The best place to eat during the day is Cafe 3. Dinner at Clark Kerr is better on average more than Crossroads. Unless you live in the Foothill dorm, trekking all the way up to Northside just to eat at the Foothill dining hall isn't always appealing. Foothill dining hall has a good Late Night menu so making the trip with your friends from time to time is fun. If you want to stock up on snacks and drinks for your dorm room, then the Bear Market in the middle of the Unit 3 dorms is a good place to spend meal points. The meal plan is definitely good for your freshmen year as you adjust to life away from home, but most students after their first year don't buy meal plans again.
Food.Author: College Junior

Food.Review: There are some places that are good initially but later you can get tired of eating there... But when you're in a rush, Golden Bear Cafe (GBC) is a safe bet. Qualcomm sells delicious handmade wraps and Peet's Coffee is a plus! Crossroads dining hall may the most variety out of all the dining halls, but in my opinion, the food isn't very good there. I think Foothill is the best dining hall.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: Restaurants are very convenient in Berkeley; they surround the campus as well as "on-campus" Res halls. Most restaurants on Southside are quite cheap, and I'm not a vegetarian, but those options are always there on the menu. There is a huge ethnic variety: Ethiopian, Indian, Korean, Vietnamese, Mediterranean, Thai, etc. There is never a night where you have to eat the same thing twice.
Food.Author: College Sophomore

Food.Review: The school's campus dining menus are very similar so you will find similar plates/ food entrees in the different cafés at school.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Food.Review: There are a variety of places to go, from very nice places to very fast, convenient cheap places. Student discounts are usually most concentrated around football season.
Food.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I have a suite in Clark Kerr, and I am very pleased with it!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Your dorming experience is really what you make of it. The Units can become a little cramped as time goes on, but Clark Kerr is a great alternative.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: I live in an Unit 1 mini-suite double, the rooms are very spacious compared to other housing.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The building structures of most of the units are pretty average and plain with the exception of Foothill. I believe what I like most about the Units is the friendliness of the students. The food served at the dining halls is pretty tasty but a lot of students complain about a few not so tasty dishes that pop up once in a while.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The Unit dorms are pretty tight knit and a decent distance away from campus. It's also right next to Telegraph where many restaurants are.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Loved living on campus. Did it freshman and sophomore year. The only issue is that there are way more students who want campus housing than there are facilities.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: dorm fee is really expensive and food quality is not that good. If you have enough money to pay the dorm fee, it is very comfortable because you don't have to get anything by yourself. everything is set. However, you should share with bunch of people. If you think that you're enjoying your private life, I really don't recommend dorm life and my rating will be accurate.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review:
Way over priced! I was in Unit 2 in a triple and it was very tight for the amount it costed. I get that rent in the bay area is expensive but I think I'd be better off renting a room off of craigslist or something. The elevators would be out a lot, but I was on a lower level so I always used the stairs. The bathrooms were kind of shabby, I'm very appreciative of the people who kept for them but young adults are messy! Also on my floor there was definitely favorite showers and showers you did not want to use (i.e. one had no flow, another didn't drain). Sometimes people had sex in the showers, some guy recorded me showering once but UCPD handled my report well and the guy was removed from UC housing. He still was able to attend school though? 

My floor had laundry on it (yay) and the building had no air conditioning so we (my roommates and I) would leave our window open most of the early months. It was loud outside at night so we used ear plugs while we slept. 

The underground communal space is nice, good study spaces and a little workout room with one working treadmill and some really nice ellipticals.

I liked being on southside close to Telegraph but I know some people didn't like being near that area.

Also there are compost bins in the rooms make sure to empty them if you use them! The guys in the room next door didn't for months and when they opened it a swarm of fruit flies came out...
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living on campus makes it much easier for people to get to know others, create new friendships and adapt to the new environment
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: The closest housing options are a block away from school.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Just like at any other school, the campus housing is convenient and easy, but it has its drawbacks. One major drawback is the price, given that you are paying to live in the Bay Area. The lottery system was difficult, but I ended up opting for an apartment with roommates on my own anyway. It's easy to find apartments in Berkeley for a better price than housing, but they not be as conveniently located to campus!
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The housing process is fairly simple, as long as you follow the instructions given. I love the arrangement of my dorm however it is quite a walk from my classes.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The units are horrible size wise but great social wise. Foothill is large rooms but no one socializes.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: They're not too roomy, but you're there to study!
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Some of the building are nice and cleaning staff does a good job
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: it's great. rooms are like any other uni but the community is SO WELCOMING
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: i lived in clark kerr dorms and those were really nice, so my experience of housing is a bit different than other peoples.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Very hard to get to classes from my building. It is the one of the furthest buildings on campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Housing is extremely expensive and there is an evident lack thereof. Housing is the only qualm I have with the school quite honestly. Most people get apartments the second year to evade the steep price. Also, many are not assured priority housing after their first year, making things more difficult and competitive. There are plans next year to place students in housing located on a completely different campus.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: great and close to campus
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: There are many housing options including three units and Clark Kerr Campus. These are all great places to live in; all of them are fairly close to the university, stores, and other facilities. The cost is average, and the social atmosphere is fairly friendly.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: I lived in a triple in one of the older buildings so the room was smaller compared to a mini suite. The bathrooms are cleaned every morning, but they quickly become a mess. By nighttime, the bathrooms becomes disgusting. My floor had a lounge so my floor can get really loud at times. If I want to get work done, I had to go to the library. However, because my floor had a lounge, my floor was pretty social and some of the best memories I had were from the conversations I had with people on my floor in the lounge late at night.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: I enjoyed living in the dorms my first year because it gave e the chance to meet other students right off the bat. I made some best friends while living in the dorm. The only things is when you are the top floor of your building and the elevator is the slowest elevator you'v ever ridden, it makes everyone a little irritated. But it also gives the floor something to bond over.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I found everything good except for how cramped it was!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I lived in Foothill myself, and I really loved the atmosphere. Great for getting work done.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Your experience has a lot to do with the kind of roommate you have. If you hit it off with your roommate then great! If not.. tough.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Berkeley housing in general is ridiculously pricey. The dorms are affordable, but so, so small.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It is kinda cramped but the people here are great.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Live in one of the units if you want to be social, it is definitely worth it.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It is a great experience ut the cost of living in the dorm is just to much. The social atmosphere was fun my freshmen year but my sophomore year is when it kind of died down. Very convenient to live in the dorms because they are close to classes.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The worst thing so far about the dorms is being paired up with an awful set of roommates and the RA never sets down the ground rules for our floor.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: One of the best ways to make friends and acquaintances.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The facilities are often not fixed, the communal kitchen has yet to have a working stove, but the people make it all worth it.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: For my first year dorms were very convenient. I met new people, had a chance to get used to the area, and didn't have to worry about where I was living. That being said, the housing search is very intense after that. Nobody I know was accepted for on campus housing for our Sophomore year, and housing is quite expensive.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It can be very stressful at times.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: The dorms are extremely small. The carpets are not that clean and the heater is always on even when it is hot outside. Th ceiling is very low and there is small closet space. The bathroom only has two stalls with warm water and one of the toilets was broken for half the year. The closeness to campus is the only benefit. However, this area is also surrounded by homeless people and always smells like drugs, hence making it unsafe.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in a converted triple with hardly any space to breathe and pay $13,000+ for it. There is barely ANY ceiling space at all if you have a top bunk. My Unit needs to be demolished and rebuilt because the rooms are ridiculously small.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It's not the best or the worst. Elevators get stuck pretty often.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Rooms need to be bigger. And we need refrigerators.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I personally like the dorms here, but I do live in a suite so that contributes to my opinion. There are cleaning services, communal kitchens in each unit, a mini gym, tv rooms, etc. The wifi is problematic, but it's alright. Location is great and close to campus-- a 5 minute walk is awesome.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Living in Unit 3 your first semester is great. It's so close to all the restaurants and campus. You can literally get to classes within 10 minutes or even less.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: There needs to be more housing on campus for students after dorms. Upperclassmen almost always need apartments unless they're regent scholars which means they can get nice housing from Martinez. As an out of state student, I have no option.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The residence hall I currently reside in is the best out of all of them. It's cleanly, spacious, quiet, and beautiful. Only downside is that it's far from campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Housing is okay, but way too expensive.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The best option to pick for housing would be to go on the bet that you have good roommates to dorm with for the experience and memories you get to share with them. The worst option would be to commute from home for those who live close by. While it is convenient, you lose connection. It isn't made for the school's social atmosphere. You miss out on events with friends, so it becomes a struggle to stay informed and close with the activities.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Dorms are quite small, even for doubles. Some dorms are more social than others.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Now in upperclassmen housing, I love the dorm experience. The RAs are more laid back and respect everyone's time and schedules without being overbearing, though are incredibly supportive and helpful when needed. The dorms are clean and modern, with excellent facilities.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Clark kerr definitel has the best dorms
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The triple and double rooms are smaller than my bedroom back home. However you get to meet some great new friends for the rest of your life!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Dorms are quite social and host floor events regularly, the apartments are spacious and really nice (only disadvantage is you don't have a meal plan automatically included and they are hard to get). WiFi can be iffy and the dorm showers are what you'd expect of dorm showers (small and bad temp. control).
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Wish there were more two bed room ones. More space in the rooms as well.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Can be really dirty, especially in the units. And the triples are really small and squished. It wasn't bad overall because I made most of my friends freshman year through the dorms, and because they are really close to campus.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It's convenient and a good way to meet people, but it is expensive and most rooms/ bathrooms are not of high-quality/ large.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Pretty urban environment but some homeless; Overall good food and cheap options.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I lived in Athlete housing as a freshman it was nice!
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review:
The dorms were a great experience (co-ed floor and bathrooms was a very interesting learning experience.)

I live in a co-op now and I love it, it was a long wait list, but it was definitely worth the wait.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: I live in a Unit 2 triple and love it. Rooms are small in the units, but they're close to campus and shops and restaurants around the Southside neighborhood of Berkeley. They can be as social or quiet as you need them to be. Clark Kerr is gorgeous and very spacious, but a farther walk to class. It's generally less social as well.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: They are quite small and overpriced.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The overall, student housing is pretty good. However, I do not like where I currently live. I live in foothill and the atmosphere there isn't my forte and I don't really like my roommates or suite mates. Foothill is very far from the other dorms, so when I hang out with my friends in the other dorms it is hard to get back to my dorm because I have to take a bus and is very inconvenient. I lived in Unit 3 over the summer and the proximity to everything was great and I wish I still lived there.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: There's pretty little space, and it costs a fortune. Most people just live in the dorms for their freshman year and then never go back.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Unit 1/2 are great. Unit 3 is kinda far. Clark kerr is way too far. Foothill is kind of far too
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: My first year I had a crappy converted triple that was ALWAYS 20 degrees hotter than the temperature in the hall. Now I have a converted double that is more spacious than the triple but it is a 15 minute walk to campus.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The RAs are nice and Stern itself is a very quiet place, ideal for studying.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Martinez is the best housing option, its the newest building, has lots of space. only reserved for upper classmen especially the engineers so if you’re looking for a fun, typical dorm life martinez is not for you. Most of them are always studying and its a quiet area. Unit 1,2,3 are typically your more standard dorms. On-campus Housing is more expensive than off campus, you can pay 1500 for a triple mini suite  in unit one THAT YOU SHARE WITH 4 OTHER PEOPLE or you can get yourself a studio/ 1 bedroom apartment relatively close to campus for cheaper. Doesn’t really make sense why they’re so expensive.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I mean I guess Unit 3 is close.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It's very convenient to use campus housing as you do not have to find an apartment and the location is very close.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: A lot of students opt for off-campus housing either their sophomore year or junior year, by which time they have found friends who they can room with and know good places near campus, which are convenient for them and safe.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Campus housing overall is a pretty awesome experience, and the community you have and the network you build is amazing.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The cost of off-campus housing is far cheaper than on-campus housing. Off-campus accommodations are always near public transportation which make them convenient. I have found a lot of advertisements off of social media and flyers around the Berkeley campus. Landlords are usually cooperative and understanding.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Although the rooms are a bit small, the social atmosphere is very stimulating. I really enjoy meeting new people and making new friends. The cost for a dorm is very expensive; however I am able to make friendships that will last a lifetime. The housing process is relatively simple and convenient.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I loved living off campus
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: Clark Kerr was far from campus, but it was spacious and had a good community atmosphere.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The expensiveness of the Bay Area housing market is well-known, and people know it. We live in a three-bedroom, and the rent is $2,000 a month.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The main objection I have to campus housing is that it is too expensive. I have chosen to live with my family instead.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: Off campus housing is much cheaper than dorming. However you are away from campus thus unless you put yourself out there. IT is very difficult to make friends.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Campus housing is not the best. Bulidings are old for the most part. But definitely close to classes.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It's definitely a lot more affordable than on-campus housing. It is just very competitive sometimes and prices may vary. There are a lot of good places that are very close to campus and are more worth living in than on-campus housing.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: On campus housing varies. There are some buildings that are better equipped with resources than others but they are each unique and have their own individual perks.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Off campus housing in Berkeley is easy to get if you know people and just do your research.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Unit 3 is not the best looking dorm but the community and the close proximity of it to everything makes it worth it.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Prices are expensive, especially when you're on financial aid and need to keep a budget without the help of having wealthy parents. Most buildings are run-down, so you'll have to settle. But it beats living in the dorms in a triple.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living in the dorms is a must-do when you go to college. It's the best way to find friends--fast. But, it is also the reason why you'll only want to live there for one year, if not less.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Apartments are way to expensive for horrible amenities. Students are in need of housing all the time, so landlords can charge whatever they want and still rent it out. It is very competitive to obtain a place.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: Living in a triple was the worst. Three people share a 144 square foot space... and we were girls. No room for anyones clothes, make up, or anything. I definitely suggest a double. But the amenities were good. Open study lounges 24/7. Laundry in the building. Bathrooms were cleaned everyday.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: Off campus housing is a much better option than on campus it's much cheaper but finding housing is the worst experience
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I loved it so much this year I decided to live on campus again!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Bay Area real estate. Enough said.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: Really depends on how lucky you get. Some places, like suites in Unit 1, are spacious, clean, and relatively close to campus. Getting a triple in Clark Kerr means you have a small unit roughly 6 blocks from campus.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: I lived in Unit 1 and thought it was perfect for dorm housing. Super close to campus, good dining hall, small gym and music room downstairs, very safe, friendly and helpful staff, and I made some great friends. I was in a triple room and all of our stuff fit just fine. My roommates and I got along but weren't the best of friends.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: The convenience is well worth the price and less than ideal apartment buildings.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Forming is a great option as a first year because you get to meet so many new people but the dorms themselves are not exactly up to par.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: When you're competing against a huge population that Berkeley hosts, you're naturally going to compete immense competition.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: One of the most expensive dorm options on college campuses. Almost impossible to list off all the things wrong with this aspect of Cal
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Most students move off campus after freshman year.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: ive had a hard time trying to find housing for the upcoming year
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: best dorms are probably the suites and minisuites, otherwise the other dorms seem to be very crowded
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in Clark Kerr and it is the best dorm to live in. They are the most spacious, there is a dining hall on the campus, and there are so many amenities. It is the farthest from campus, but it is definitely worth it.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Off-campus housing is most definitely available, it's just more to deal with. That's why I have just chose to stay on campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living in the dorms re a great convenience because it allows for the students to be close to campus. It also allows students to meet new people from different backgrounds and helps with networking.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I haven't lived off campus but have found an apartment for next year. The apartment search is chaotic and you have to move quickly to get a place you like. Apartments are cheaper than living on campus but they still seem very expensive ($600-800 for a shared room).
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I really love the dorms. The one I live in is a block from campus and is close to all sorts of cool things. It's a great way to meet people and I love that I always have company available if I want it. They're also a lot more spacious and clean than I expected.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I do not yet live off campus. I am looking for a place with some friends and so far the process has been fairly simple.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Dorms are definitely not the most comfortable living places. However, it is very easy to make lasting friendships, which makes up for the discomfort and long walk to campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Lot's of people, not enough space. What can you expect?
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Too expensive for the quality given.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: There are a lot of apartments and it can be tough to get one but it gets easier with experience.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I prefer to cook my own food. Also the "on campus" housing is actually upwards of three blocks away from campus which is pretty inconvenient.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Super expensive, pretty hard to find decent housing close to campus
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I will be living in my sorority which is the best deal that you can find in Berkeley because it is close and all my meals are covered
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I lived in a Clark Kerr triple and have a very spacious room. The Clark Kerr dorm rooms are much larger than the units. The dinning hall at CKC is the best dinning hall on campus. A lot of athletes live here and there a lot of students in the GreeK system. I love going to the pool, tennis courts, mini gym, and all the hiking trails right behind my dorm. Also there are a lot of nice grass areas to tan and do homework. The only downside is that it is about a 10 min walk to campus, which is not bad at all and the walk is mostly through a residential area. If you really don't like the walk then you can take the bus which is very convenient and free!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Very expensive. Landlord's market on all fronts.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Dorms are pretty typical for college. Social atmosphere was great. Had chance to meet new people, who have become my off-campus roommates.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Clark Kerr suites are very spacious, well kept, and almost like a hotel.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: A lot of options and very student-friendly, but rent and deposits can be pretty outrageous. It is city prices, definitely.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: I don't have a lot of experience with off campus housing because I am a freshman and am living in my sorority next year however it seems like finding off campus housing is easy, it just isn't always cheap.  In general living in Berkeley and the Bay Area is expensive, so as long as off campus housing is cheaper than the dorms (so far it seems like everything is) then I consider it worth while.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in Clark Kerr Campus and it is the best!! I am in a triple but my room is double the size of a room in the Units and I get tons of sunlight and the building is new-ish and clean.  Clark Kerr is farther away from campus but 100% worth the walk because it is right next to the fire trails and you get away from all of the commotion around campus.  Also half of my floor is in greek life so if you are planning on joining greek life I would highly recommend CKC.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Housing tends to be pretty overpriced since you'd have to pay a hefty amount just to get an old and run-down apartment. Landlords and rental agencies can be a pain to deal with and there's fierce competition for housing.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in the Unit 3 dorms, which are conveniently located pretty close to campus but tend to be extremely loud at night. It's rather hard to sleep due to noise from the courtyard, hallway, and neighboring rooms. The housing office isn't very helpful since I know one of my floormates called before the assignments were made asking to change his first choice from a triple to a double and the housing office said they would take care of it, but he ended up getting assigned a double. I also sent a form requesting housing accommodations due to my insomnia and provided the necessary medical documentation, but haven't gotten a response and it's been over a month.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Expensive but doable. Not bad all at if you look early enough.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Luckily I am in the Clark Kerr dorms for my freshman year. These are significantly more spacious than any of the Units. Overall it is rather clean but you must get to used to the idea of gender neutral bathrooms.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Off-campus housing grants great freedom.  Parking is optional since a car is optional.  There is a variety of housing that are either close or far from campus.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: depends on which housing unit and what kind of room--triples are definitely very tight. Difficult to study in room if you live on Southside
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: most people move out of the dorms after their first year
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Would like larger dorms.  Really get along w/floor
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The housing is way too expensive.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: High prices for small apartments
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Rooms are a little small but hall staff and residents are awesome.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I lived in an off campus house my freshman year without any assistance from school, and it was alright.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Dorm life is fun is you have tolerable roommates, civilized floor-mates and an open mind to accept and respect others for what they do.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The renting fees are above the average compare to other continents.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The style of the buildings on campus varies a lot, but they're all very beautiful.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Off campus housing is a great option here. It is significantly cheaper than the university housing, and you can generally get a place pretty close to campus at a decent price.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I loved dorm life. They were close to campus and they included a meal plan. I look forward to becoming an RA so that I can have that experience again!
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: There are many apartments, but a lot of them have some utility issues. Some might be further away than the dorms, and pricing is average. But it's a lot more spacious than the dorms.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Some dorms are much further from the campus than others, and things like the elevator and heater have broken down a few times.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Campus housing is quite pricey, but it makes up for being expensive with it's relative close-ness to campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Can be real hit-or-miss. Prices of course increase the closer to campus you are. There is a wide selection in terms of apartments, studios, houses, renting a room in a house
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: There are lots of amenities when living in the units. I'm in Unit 1 and I always use the recreational gym, laundry machines, local mailing system, and communal lounges/study center spaces.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living in the dorms are good because they are close to campus, and housing is guaranteed.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Dorming is great for your first year, wouldn't have it any other way
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Really expensive to live off or on campus. Greek life is a good option because living in houses is generally cheaper than dorms or apartments
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The dorms are really bad and overpriced. Clark Kerr dorms are definitely nicer but not worth the money. I would recommend living in the units because they are closest to campus. The living conditions are pretty low in all dorms, so at least the units are in convenient locations.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living on-campus is expensive, however some of my closest friends came from the dorms. Everyone is so nice, and the staff is really accommodating.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: There are a lot of options for off-campus housing, which are significantly cheaper than dorms.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: The Units are regular college living. Bowles, Stern, and Foothill are not very social. Clark Kerr is a nice area however it is far from campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Super expensive by virtue of being near UCB
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Its a lot of housing opportunities in UC Berkeley and if you will act on time you can get not very expencive , dissent place for yourself
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: While living off-campus will probably save you money, the off-campus selections tend to be dirtier. You should be able to get more space for your money compared to on-campus housing, but you also need to act fast, since there are so many students here.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: I have met many friends through my dorm floor, and although the rooms (I'm in a unit 2 triple) are small they are still manageable
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It is expensive but close to campus and full of new people to meet.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It is farther from campus and your classes but it is also cheaper than on-campus housing.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Living on-campus is a great experience and a good way to get to meet other students.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Off-campus housing is a convenient type of housing for upperclassmen who are looking for cheaper places to live in. For new incoming students, off-campus housing may not be the best choice even though it may be cheaper. New incoming students should be in an environment around other students to start developing networks and connections on campus with other students and they will not be able to do that as easy if they were to live off-campus.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The rules are only enforced if the RA on duty is in the mood. Particularly for noise violations.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Higher prices and fair-condition housing if opting for close proximity to campus, but cost easily split amongst roommates.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Foothill dorms provide good environment for studying.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: people are generally close to campus however housing is some of the most expensive in the nation
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: it's definitely cheaper than campus housing
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: it's the best decision I made! living on campus!
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Too expensive. If you want to find a cheap apartment, it's either far from campus, dirty and looks like it's going to collapse at any minute, or you might have to cramp in a number people to lower costs.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: I have had great experiences with apartments in the area.  It can get expensive but it is usually high quality.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: There are a few expected issues with cleanliness and upkeep but they work very hard to make that happen.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: Finding a decent place to stay for a reasonable price is difficult. Start your search early (March).
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Great variety, but terribly overpriced room and board.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: The affordability compared to campus housing is phenomenal. It's never hard to find a place to live, just a good deal.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Not worth the cost, and if you are unlucky enough to live in a dorm without a kitchen you are condemned to eating bland, redundant, poorly served dining hall food. The dorms share the smoking ban, so they are very inconvenient for smokers of any type. Nowhere to wash dishes, and no chance of escaping an awful roommate.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I lived in Unit 1. It was a comfortable distance from campus and there were study lounges which proved to help out throughout the year. However, I did live in a triple and at times I felt a bit cramped.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Cons of living off campus is that it is cheaper than on campus housing. Parking sucks. Safety is not that great. Call bear walk, or walk with friends.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Foothill is definitely the best place to live. It has great food, and quite a view! It is close to the science (excluding plant science), math, and engineering buildings, so it is convenient for those majoring in these fields. The dorm is a bit of a walk up because it's on the side of a hill. One thing to think about is if you live in the unit dorms, you probably have a higher probability of getting sick. This is inevitable in dormitory life, but I think in foothill, there are more windows, and higher air circulation. Also, there's not too much crowding.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: This is the part that sucks the most, really. At best you will share a room with another student, or maybe even three others. You can rent a single bedroom for yourself but it will not be cheap.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: All I can say, is that it's pretty pricey here no matter what it is that you're doing. Parking is difficult and expensive, so are rooms for rent.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Decided to stay on campus again because off campus wasn't much cheaper unless you were willing to go further away.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: fun if your into social things. kinda loud otherwise
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Compared to the other housing on campus, foothill is relatively large- however, it is far from most classes and is also more expensive. Socially though, the people here are a mix of both very studios and social which is nice.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I lived in the mini suites os the rooms were spacious but the regular dorms are crowded specially Unit 3 which is the oldest
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: You cannot have it all in CAL. Housing is very expensive but if you want to be near social life you must pay outrageous prices for very old apartments.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: I currently live off-campus and loving it. I have an expensive place but to get my own room rather than my own bed, its worth it. I can work at home without being bothered.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I don't live on campus but I hear living on campus is great
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Not very high quality, so the prices are pretty high.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The rent is too damn high
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: too many parties, sex in the dorms, gross!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Some places are old and dirty and they are too expensive! It is stupid how they charge for parking garages!
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It is quite crowded and dirty at some parts.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It is very expensive to live in Berkeley overall. A one bed one bath apartment can cost $2000.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review:
Pros:

1. You'll probably be in off-campus housing after freshman year anyway, unless you're a transfer student.

2. A ton of neighborhoods within walking distance, with a lot of good restaurants.

3. Many apartment complexes have students, so there are student amenities - laundry machines, year-long leases that end in June, etc.

4. Prices can be somewhat high, but much cheaper than dorms. Plus, you won't have to always use meal points in Crossroads!

Cons:

1. Some neighborhoods might be unsafe. There are robberies and muggings, but mostly be aware of your surroundings and try to use campus transportation at night if you're alone (BearWalk).

2. Parking is expensive. Any street parking needs a permit or it has a 2-4 hour meter limit. Covered parking is around $100 per month.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: I live off-campus and I love it! Walking back at night is definitely a little scary but my apartment isn't too far so it isn't bad. Berkeley also has a service called BearWalk that you can totally use to your advantage!
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: There are great amenities, but I expected better from such a renowned school. I know that UC Davis and UC Irvine have wonderful dorms, and it frustrates me that Cal's dorm situation is insufficient.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Expensive rent, lack of parking, sketchy landlords, at least near campus. If you have a car or are willing to bus, consider looking in areas further from campus. It's typically cheaper, and the landlords are more trustworthy.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: Expensive as most campus housing is. Standard compared to other universities, close to campus and walking distance to mostly everything necessary.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: Be on top of it when it comes to off-campus housing!  Do not wait until the last minute to find off-campus housing because I guarantee that you will not find any.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: My favorite thing about campus housing is the inclusion of meal points and how close it is to campus.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: If your lucky you get one of your choices during lotto, but if not oh well. It can get stuffy in the rooms where they made 4 people go, instead of 2 or 3. There is an overcrowded feel at times, but it works out.
Housing.Author: College Student

Housing.Review: Berkeley doesn't have many options and it will up fast. You can look through ones that offer roomate options for better availability and prices.
Housing.Author: College Student

Housing.Review: I like how close it is to campus, but the walk uphill can be killer. I also wish there were more washers/dryers and if laundry didn't cost so much.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Basically everyone lives off campus after freshman year. It's good if you look early enough.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Campus housing is very convenient; it allows you to get to know people who live in your building and especially on your floor, which has been great for me as a spring-admit to Berkeley. I started in January and it hasn't been hard for me to make friends at all! The girls on my floor are so welcoming and sweet, I felt like a part of their group almost immediately.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Same as the dorm without socks everywhere.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Here it totally depends where you're living, some of the dorms are very close but small and old and others are far, very large and new.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Rooms are small and bleak, but clean and have everything you need.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Expensive and varies from very new to very old. Totally worth it for the experence.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: Lot's of options. Expensive and small but reasonable for the area.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The price goes up as you move away from campus.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: I have only been living on campus for a few weeks now, but it does not seem so bad and I feel that after another week or so I should have no problem.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Well there is a variety including apartments and co-ops, but I believe there is not much availability. Also, the process can be difficult for spring admits because it begins relatively early in the semester and spring admits have only been attending the campus for a short period of time.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: There are so many different places, mostly apartments. Some houses though are available as well. The proximity to campus definitely varies, but with a bike and the bus system, anything is doable. The prices tend to be higher in the bay area, but they are still fair. You can find anything from a studio to around 6-bedroom places.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Social and usually friendly but not too quiet when you need
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It's much cheaper than on-campus housing and affords more flexibility but is difficult to find
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in Stern, the all-girls dorm, that is known to be antisocial. However, during my first semester at UC Berkeley, I have discovered that if you want to be social, it is easy. There are so many events that mentors and RAs host, as well as unit-wide events, such as dances and karaoke nights.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Housing prices can get a little pricey, especially for the amount of space and number of amenities you get. Most apartments near campus that are a reasonable price have old heaters and washing machines/dryers, and most don't have dishwashers. Landlords sometimes look down on students and take advantage of their inexperience.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Off-campus housing is awesome at Berkeley. So many options.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: No matter what school you go to, dorms aren't going to be spectacular. However, I really enjoyed living in the dorms this year. Cool people and pretty big room!
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I love that I can roll out of bed 10 minutes before class starts and get to class in no time. Dorms are very close to campus, but are also in the city and therefore near dinning and boutiques. Everything is walking-distance.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The Units are WAY too expensive for a room that is half the size of my room at home and I can only use half the space.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Will be living in an apartment next year
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: I live in a Mini suite
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It's expensive, and depending on which dorm you get into it's small and shabby as well. But the college experience wouldn't be the same without dorm life.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: It could be better, and especially for the quality it could be cheaper.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Wiiiiiiiiide variety, so start searching early in spring semester for your fall housing before all the nicest stuff gets taken. Proximity and safety are usually great, as are landlords.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Strictness varies considerably (as does attractiveness), and it's all around expensive. But nearly all of them are bright, conveniently located, and quite social.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: The unit four area (foothill, stern and bowles) tend to get extremely anti-social, so I would avoid those dorms.  Unit 2 is the farthest from campus, and both unit 1 and 3 are closest.
Housing.Author: College Junior
